author: {'steamid': '76561198180078861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1495485073}
review:
Command Conquer severler için şunu bir başta söylüyeyim.
Önceki Command Conquer serilerinden çok farklı bir oyun.
seviye sistemi var ve bu seviyene göre askerler,tanklar,uçaklar üretebilirsin.
önceki Command Conquer yapılarının hiç biri yok.
asker üretim binası,hava alanı,hangar vb hiç bir şekilde bulunmamaktadır.
bunların hepsini 3 yapı karşılamaktadır ve sadece birini seçebilmek hakkınız var.
(eğer bir başka yapıyı üretmek isterseniz şuanki seçili olan üssü yıkıp istediğiniz üssü getirtmek zorundasınız ve bununda normal olarak belirli bir sayıda yapabilirsiniz ve bu işlemler gerçekleşirken baya bi zaman kaybı yaşanmaktadır,zaman kaybına neden olan şey üssün kendini imha etmesidir.)
Saldırı,Defans,Support(support değilde değimi yerindeyse havacı :) )
Oyundaki üniteleri çok beğendim.
oyunda en çekilmez şey asker üretim limitidir.
gereğinden az olması oyunu kat ve kat zorlaştırıyor ve bazende işi çıkmaza sürüyor.
oyun co-op oynanabilir  bir yapıya sahip.
arkadaşlarınızlan veya ea serverlerinden bir başka kimseylede musabaka edebilir veya campagin yardımlaşmaları yapabilrisiniz.
incelemlere göz atarsanız çoğu olumsuz ama eğerki CC hayranıysanız almanızı tavsiye edebilirim.
oyunun kötü yanları varken bir o kadarda iyi yanları mevcut, ve bu oran yarı yarıyadır.
kötü yanları iyi yanlarına baskın gelmezken  iyi yanlarıda kötü yanlarına baskın gelmiyor ve ortaya değişik fikirlere sahip bir kitle çıkıyor :)
Eğer Command Conquer serisini bitirdim demek istiyorsanız alın :)
Eski Command Conquer serilerinde olduğu gibi üniteler kurup asker,uçak,tank üretip savaşmak  istiyorsanız hayal kırıklılığına uğrarsınız :)

Not : indirimdeyken almanızı tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961260165', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1495077876}
review:
This game isn't even an RTS, it's a squad moba where your "heroes" shit out creeps that you can control. They tried to copy dawn of war 2 but failed in an epic way. This isn't new for Electronic Arts, it seems the format for this company is to pump out a hot piece of crap within 3 months then charge people 80 dollars for it.

This game single handedly killed the franchise, which was weakening after Red Alert 3. EA got almost everything right with Tiberian sun and Generals, but who ever took over the leadership after that is obviously a junky or a retard of some sort.

Pros:
-It's cheap
-multiplayer still works
-story

Cons:
-No base building
-Still using the extremely dated generals engine
-Not balanced at all
-Population is extremely small
-Killed the franchise

It would be different if EA revisted the series and corrected all their mistakes, but instead they doubled down and made a free to play browser game that does not resemble the series at all, which was called Tiberian/Tiberium Alliances.

If you are reading this, don't bother buying this hunk of shit. Visit cnc online and just download the older games, patch them with the cnc online patch and you will be able to play multiplayer again. And for the love of god stop giving EA money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984051122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1495041997}
review:
I'm very glad that I bought the C&C Bundle because of Red Alert 3 and Tiberium Wars but most definately not because of Tiberian Twilight. I'm astonished EA published this. I have no idea what is going on with this game. The menus are barely there. There are few options when you start a (pseudo-)"skirmish" and with most of those I can't imagine what they do most of the time. The crucial option in a FACTION-based RTS is being able to change said faction but I couldn't figure out how to do that. On top of that it's predecessors look amazing...this does not.

Not to mention the gameplay. To be fair I did not look into the campaign (and I probably won't in the near future) but when I go into a skirmish in an RTS and I can't figure out what's going on in front of me then I don't want to play that game anymore. C&C is not about spawning some random units and then pillow-fighting over some random control-node but thats how it feels here.

In conclusion: Save yourself the time and money and don't buy this. I would't have bought it myself but I was gonna buy C&C 3 and Red Alert 3 (on sale at the moment I bought the bundle) anyway and in the "Command & Conquer Pack" bundle basically got Tiberian Twilight "for free".

author: {'steamid': '76561197990399454', 'num_games_owned': 937, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1464064108}
review:
Foreward: Time listed played for this title does not reflect full play-time w/ game, have completed both campaigns.

Its painful to even be on this storepage writing this review. I can honestly feel a tiny twinge of a headache coming on so i'll get to my points.

Command & Conquer, as a series, is one of the grandfathers of all modern base-building RTS games up there with Warcraft as well. While the series saw a few minor adjustments to the lore here 'n there it was always a very solid setting whose factions i'll cover briefly:

The Brotherhood of Nod is/was a paramilitary organization with ties to just about every major country that isn't afflicted w/ Tiberium or the first world "Blue zones". It's ranks are comprised not JUST of hundreds of millions of loyal militia but also extremely well-trained and well organized black ops infiltrators and die-hard fantical soldiers. Lead by "Kane", while it was never openly announced, it was highly alluded to that he was in fact the mythical brother of Abel from the bible, thus meaning he has existed since almost the literal dawn of time. While Kane was always viewed as EXTREMELY charismatic, he was also astoundingly cunning and a survivor above all, surviving not one but 2 seperate attacks from WMD-scale orbital weapons platforms despite being at the ground-zero of both attacks.

In C&C 4 this appears to have all been retconned and it now alludes that Kane is an alien seeking to go home.

The Global Defense Initiative (or GDI) is effectively the UN/NATO and every other western first-world 3 or 4 letter organization all smashed into one giant organization. GDI are essentially "The good guys", the Free world all gathered together to try and stomp out The Brotherhood of Nod and stop Tiberium from spreading across the globe, the highly toxic green crystal has turned much of the planet into an uninhabitable hellscape labled "Red Zones" and semi-infested zones (Yellow zones) both of which Nod operates out of predominantly.

Now, as mentioned previously, base-building was extremely important in previous games because your resources were rarely directly inside your base and could deplete rapidly, creating a NEED to control the map's terrain to move to new fields while the expended ones slooooowly regenerated. There was also the matter that air units had to return to the structure that created them to resupply, even the very use of your minimap was a feature given by one of your buildings.

Here, thats no longer the case, base building has been entirely removed and replaced with different 'styles' of command structure, restricting access to what units you can produce. It takes away a huge aspect of the game for the sake of trying to make the game more 'user friendly' but instead only takes away from the experience.

On top of this, C&C 4 was the ending to the story of Kane as far as we were told, it is the conclusion......and it's endings answers precisely zero plot questions despite more and more cropping up as the series progressed. Theres also the matter that the game tries to shoe-horn in a Co-Op experience, something none of the previous games did and while good on paper, it fails to make up for the rest of the game's failures.

In short, C&C 4 neutered a major part of what made the earlier games unique, failed to deliver any note-worthy answers to questions that'd existed since the series began over a decade ago and left most (if not all) of it's fans (as is probably apparent by the reviews) with a very very sour taste in our mouths.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050347543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1407096446}
review:
The final stunning conclusion to the Tiberium Wars series this game could have been... but ultimately it wasn't. It is still fun to play provided you ignore the previous 15+ years of lore. I liked the game inspite of wanting to hate it.

The biggest issue is EA's attempt to "introduce a multitude of innovations to the classic fast and fluid Command & Conquer gameplay". BIG MISTAKE! A bit of fine tuning or maybe a single change would have been fine and accepted by the masses but attempting to turn the entire RTS genre on it's head from it's root origins way back in Dune 2: Battle for Arrakis/Building a Dynasty (yep I owned both and argued with friends about the title) was a bad idea that wasn't play tested enough and then when executed signaled the death bell of this otherwise Glorious Franchaise.

Audio/Sound: 10/10. The sound engineering and audio in the game is freaking brilliant. The music is absoluting amazing and soulful with each battle/mission. The menu music almost makes you feel like you're in some form of command centre and the troops are awaiting your orders to throw themselves into the fray. It's very thematic and is done well, even the FMV have an excellent tone to them.

Video: 8/10. The visuals are fantastic. The FMV have always been top notch (ignoring Tiberium Dawn's blue-screen era) and they don't disappoint. But while in game I can't help but feel the visuals got a severe downgrade from the E3 trailers and previews. Not sure if it was a QA or coding issue that changed this but it was a bit of a disappointment. But still the game looks great compred to some of the RTS clones out there.

Gameplay: 4/10. Sadly this is where it all goes to hell. It is C&C. But it's not the RTS we want. Or the one we deserve. Mobile fluid command structures aren't anything new. Dark Reign, Supreme Commander and a few others have done this before and always to a varying degree of failure when it comes to reception of the players. Why they decided to follow this course is a mystery... maybe they did want the franchaise to end and die? Why? No idea.

To non-C&C fans of RTS games I must suggest that you avoid this. To the C&C fans whom want to see an ending... well I'm a hardcore fan and played them all back to back(even Renegade) before getting to this game and for me it was worth it to get an ending. If you're not that keen but want to see an ending then I suggest youtube'ing the FMV cinematics but you probably won't get the same impact.

I will say this having an end boss fight was unexpected and a nice twist and the GDI bring the pain with their ultimate super-heavy vehicle (no spoilers I promise) but holy heck it kicks butt and took me 26 minutes to bring down... yep it's that tough but then again I like to play on stupidly hard cause I'm a sucker for pain... hrm maybe that's why I liked the game.

Game on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153970007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1494897547}
review:
Got this for less than $5 in a sale and in a bundle.. effectively making it pretty much free after the bundling. I still regret it.
The deep discount doesn't change my disgust with the route EA took the franchise. This is like an entirely different game. 
This is NOT Command & Conquer. I'm not sure what it is trying to be.. but they missed the mark so hard it's a different genre. When you need several levels of tutorials to explain just how different it is.. you F*%@ED UP! 
C&C should be intuitive enough to rts players without that need. Sorely disappointed. Deleted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120894533', 'num_games_owned': 1139, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1684082675}
review:
I've played every Command & Conquer game since 1995. Every release kept me going on for hours. As most others probably were, was glad beyond believe that the fourth and final installment in the long lasting Tiberium series was coming, but when I finally got the game... well simply enough this isn't Command & Conquer, It's a horrid waste of money and time with practically nothing in common with past installments and answers almost none of the questions we were told it would answer and as such this "Epic conclusion of the Tiberium saga" as EA calls it, doesn't deserve to be honored with the title of Command & Conquer 4. 

In short Command & Conquer 4 is atrocious, end of story. Despite the inclusion of several new features, Command & Conquer 4 is an unenjoyable and easily forgettable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238231880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1514816373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005498613', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1494107485}
review:
I "played" via ""Origin"" mostly so my time shown here doesn't represent the time I've put into the game but.. 
Heres a video version of this.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuWXHvvoOiA

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/RebusForeverReviews#curation

A Mini 'Rebview'!!

Do you like real-time strategy games?
Did you while away hours, just playing skirmish maps  throughout the C&C franchise ?
Did you marvel at the hammy acting and silly stories in the campaign and test friendships in vs battles?
Did you enjoy managing your base and slowly wresting control of the map from your opponents, all the while protecting your harvesters and amassing your forces for that planned overwhelming assault? 
Is Command and Conquer 4 the game for you?
Nope, probably not. 

Thanks for reading, check my other reviews.

What!!?

What do you mean that's not good enough? 

Okay then, second time's a charm....
Do you hate previous Command and Conquer games and wish they never existed? 
Did you play level 7 of Dune 2 as a child and decide if you can't have a base nobody should?
Do you think innovation within a franchise should automatically mean a complete and utter deviation from that franchise's core mechanics? 
Do you get a sense of inner fulfillment when EA takes over other studios and then homogenizes and dumbs their properties down?
Then this might be the game for you..... 
You monster. 

Firstly, sorry to the live action actors, they acted their little hearts out.
And now the dirty work.... 
The game itself 'features' a perspective limited to about 3ft off the ground.
Replacing bases and harvesters is a crawler mechanic done better elsewhere.
The crawler acts as a mobile HQ that can deploy sort of acting like a base, but not.
Limited unit selection is improved slightly as each of the 3 crawlers for the two factions has a selection of unique abilities and units - providing a thin façade of choice - so long as your choice doesn't involve wanting to play a Command and Conquer game!

The game does look good for its age and still had a bunch of people playing it online, but based on my time with the game I'm forced to assume they get some sort of masochistic thrill from sticking with it, but far be it from me to kink shame.

The units may look acceptable but the tiny unit cap in the missions I played was not, the game may have merits when considered as its own thing, but as a long time fan of the franchise and Westwood's work it pains me to see the Command and Conquer title connected to this game.

C&C 4 is a compelling Asylum B movie, tethered to a game forged by an exact and precise series of awful decision; like an entire solar system whose planets orbit comes into alignment once every billion years and unleashes some dark force, Command and Conquer 4 came into being- spawned from a heady mix of EA's contempt for the franchise and a desire for accessibility that seemingly took precedence at every stage of designing the games mechanics.  

If you are new to the franchise or enjoyed Homeworld Deserts of Karak it might be worth playing but as a Command and Conquer fan I'd be honoured to recomend that nobody play this game, ever, not even for nostalgia.... 

Thanks for the read and if you enjoyed this feedback is always appreciated.
If you checked out the video review lemme know you came from Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2454, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 1438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1493815543}
review:
The worst disgrace EA has ever published. Take a 20 year old strategy series with countless great games, grind it to dust, remove key elements of the entire genre, make it pseudo-coop-multiplayer-online-only and watch it all burn to the ground.

Worst company decision of EA, ever. I wish Westwood wouldn't have gone bankrupt and they would have made C&C Generals 2.

Stay away from this. Even as a gift, you should remove this from your library. You should never pay a single cent for it. Never.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049925877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1491772024}
review:
Lorsque j'ai commencé je ne me doutais pas à quel point le bashing sur ce jeu était vrai, non seulement il est très court, mais la gestion des unités est passez moi l'expression "à chié", fini le développement stratgique via les centrales, plus de centrales plus deconstruction, non là on est cantonné la majeur partie du temps à 50, pas 50 unités, mais un chiffre random de 50 quelque fois moins quelque fois plus, sachant qu'n principe les unités coûte 3 ou 6 points les 50 sont vite atteind !

J'ai déjà fini avec le NOD là je fait les GDI mais c'est jsute par ce que je l'ai acheté, pas par plaisir,

ce jeu n'a RIEN à voir avec la license, c'est de la DAUBE !

LE pire du pire reste les scrins, dans le 3 sublime, ici rien d'autre qu'une bestiole sortie de spore, sur 3 pattes, on aurait pas pu faire pire

author: {'steamid': '76561198090998916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1404234194}
review:
It's taken me a while (Like 2 years I think) but I'd finally like to come around to say that this game is garbage. Having been a huge fan of the series since childhood, to see it become something so simplistic and yet so convoluted is painful. I've played better RTS on my tablet. This game is a steaming pile of garbage, and barely lives up to even being called an RTS. On top of that, running it is a pain. author: {'steamid': '76561197998648850', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 63, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1710885574}
review:
It made me cry. I first got a hold of Command and Conquer with Red Alert Retaliation on the PSX when my dad came home from Bosnia. When I asked him if I could play it, he said it would just make me mad. I was maybe 6. I didn't know what to do. I learned how to select and grab units by holding down the X button and moving the directional buttons. I selected all my units and would move them about. I didn't know that big ass fucking truck could turn into a structure that built more structures. Boy, was I fucking excited then! I used to leave my playstation on in the morning and come back after school to continue with my skirmishes. I'd like to play "Peacekeeper" where I'd prevent the cpu's from killing each other off. Then I got the Firestorm pack. Fast Forward to about maybe 9 years later and I had a pc in my room. One of those prebuilt ones your mom and dad give you when they get a new one. 

I bought the Pack that contained Red Alert 2. Red Alert 2 Yuris Revenge. Renegade. Tiberian Sun. and Firestorm. It was with Renegade that I got on the internet and found out about Gamespy. Fuck I miss the ol days. It was great. I was ignorant and didn't know about the greed of companies yet. Then eventually CnC3 came out. I was HYPED! I thought I was for GDI. But then Kane's Wrath came out. Now Im a Noddie fer lyfe! 

Then.... Then IT came out. The abomination called CNC4. I bought it of course. I kept telling myself that it had to have base building in it. Why would they do that?! Why would they turn it into a cash grab?! Don't they care about us? I never played the campaign. I didn't want to. 

Until today. March 24th 2017. I will face the campaign and deal with it. Because I know EA will never part with the IP. They suck companies dry and then throw them in the pit of the dead and move on to the next ones. 

RIP Westwood and my childhood innocence. 

Goodluck to Petroglyph.

And may EA and every Executive there burn in hell.

At 4:44 AM on March 25th. I finished the NoD campaign. I feel sick to my stomach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043860597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1699281973}
review:
A kick in the teeth to the Command and Conquer: Tiberium Wars series. If there was an actual story at all, it was more bland than a box of uncooked rice. The pvp system is absolute crap, and you will find yourself needing to be carried to even begin to be able to fight with one specific class of army at a time. Because to hell with unit diversity.

This was a bastardization of the RTS genre, and frankly I want to set my copy on fire, but since it's digital, I guess a giant thumbs down works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367039323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2426, 'last_played': 1489864733}
review:
Le jeu est joli mais on passe d'un jeu où on commandait une armée à un jeu où on dirige quelques unités (16 petites unités à 3 pts, ou quelques grosses unités à 10 pts). Au lieu d'avoir une base, on a le choix entre 3 crawlers.

Les scénarii ressemblent plus à de petites énigmes, à résoudre : choisir le bon crawler, produire les bonnes unités pour résoudre le scénario.
Plus de ressource à récolter. Il y a quelques cristaux sur la map, qui servent à acheter des boost.

Bref, ça n'est plus le Command & Conquer du passé. C'est très différent, parfois frustrant, parfois novateur.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991301599', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1489670652}
review:
As a big fan of the C&C series I had big hopes for this game based on the previous episodes. It's a complete disappointment, it's absolutely different than the previous games, they took everything from it that made it C&C, no base building, no money, lack of story and proper game modes... The only thing I can mention as positive is the graphics.

If you are thinking about buying it, let me give you an advice: Do NOT buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080582058', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2909, 'last_played': 1430776940}
review:
(SUMMARY OF THIS REVIEW: DON'T BUY THIS GAME. EA KILLED CNC WITH THIS GAME)

With this game, Command and Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight, electronic arts put forth their single greatest INSULT to the gaming community, and ultimately one of the dumbest business decisions in gaming history. In a pathetic, short sighted attempt at trying to push the highly coveted Command And Conquer brand onto a new generation of gamer, they have destroyed everything CNC has stood for.

In order to appeal to a NEW playerbase of (GUESSTIMATE) 50 000-80 000 players from a NEW generation of gamers, they have created a fast paced RTS that is so heavily disconnected from the ENTIRE CNC genre up to this point, it is unrecognizeable as an actual command and conquer title, and more closely resembles a next-gen mobile-tower defense game.

In doing so, EA Games made its BIGGEST mistake. In order to appeal to a NEW small audience, they ALIENATED the older audience which comprises over two MILLION players, probably more. From both a lore standpoint and shockingly a business standpoint, CNC4 was a BIG mistake.

While CNC 4 is in itself a good game for what it is, not a true RTS but more an RTS based mobile tower defense game. Good graphics, good gameplay, good story, brilliant unit balancing, as always to be expected from a CNC title. But, the game is NOT command and conquer. The original CNC games were base building, calling on MASSIVE armies of PC shattering numbers of units into HUGE, tiny or small battlefields.

THAT is what the players of the CNC series grew up with. Thats what they fell in love with. THAT gameplay mechanic of building a fortress and a massve army was what drove CNC fans down its very long history to make it one of if not THE greatest RTS-defining franchises in gaming history.

Command and Conquer universe - with the exception of CNC Renegade (an FPS based in the tiberium universe) - has been defined by base building, resource management, resource collection, base defense, tactical decisions and heavy strategy that have molded playstyles that have blown away other RTS games, and even set the precedent on what to beat for the entire RTS gaming industry.

Command and Conquer Generals and its extension Zero Hour, STILL have a loyal fan base, online community and very extensive modding community that, years on, is still loyally playing a game they've had for ages, completely ignoring anything NEW you try to produce. Most true CNC fans will buy CNC4 because its command and conquer, but will NEVER play it after the first few times logging in.

But, for now i shall leave you with the following review of CNC4 Tib Twilight:

For what it is, it's a good, fun game.

Good Graphics.
Good gameplay.
Good story.
Good skirmish modes.
Challenging AI.

But these do not excuse it. It is NOT command and conquer, and for this reason

I DO NOT CONSIDER THIS GAME, CNC4 TIBERIAN TWILIGHT, TO BE CANON TO THE CNC FRANCHISE.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005406191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 2749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1648978028}
review:
Greetings!  I’m going to say something that doesn’t seem the norm based off the reviews of this game.  I liked this game.  I’ve always been a fan of Command & Conquer and although this game definitely isn’t my favorite it does seem to hold up pretty well.

Graphics:  No, these graphics aren’t amazing but they do hold up from when the game first came out.  I can’t really complain as they were pretty amazing when the game first came out, they hold up pretty well.  Battle damage is still present and the particle effects are still pretty good. I’d love to see more RTS do battle damage and such.

Mechanics:  I have to compare this to a modern product and with that said the mechanics do hold up tolerably but I keep going back to the gold standard of controls for RTS:  StarCraft 2.  I wish RTS would just look at the standard SC2 has set and make that their minimum.  Yes, you need innovation but you should start at least with the core.  I did find the unit selection double press feature very useful (on press you select all combat units, double and you select all units).  If I was rating this completely on mechanics I’d probably be more in the not recommend as the controls have not kept up in the world of precision, to many times I couldn’t move a unit too close to something or his pathing would lead him somewhere completely opposite of where I wanted him to go.  And…one game type for skirmish?  Really? Sigh.

RPG:  I wish more games would include some of the leveling features that this game has, I’d love to see a mode where you level up and unlock new units, or include veterancy.  Yes, I know these aren’t very ‘competitive’ features, so maybe make them toggled or their own game type.  In fact, the core design of this game (the mobile base building and focus on less units and more action) would be an amazing game type for RTS but kind of falls flat as the core component.  Ultimately, I would have loved to see this game take off more so if nothing else these game types would have continued on.

Story:  Unfortunately, this story felt the most forgettable over all the other C&C games.  I know I beat this when it first came out but for the life of me didn’t remember any of the story, I actually remember the story of most of the C&C world but this one slipped me.  I’m not sure if they weren’t trying but it actually felt more like a game copying the C&C world than a C&C game.

Ultimately, I am cycling between a positive or negative review.  I look at everything and see more negative thoughts than positive, but this game is 6 years old and I just replayed the campaign and overall enjoyed it… but I love C&C.  Should you buy this?  Eh, if you like C&C yes, if you are just looking for a good RTS I’d look elsewhere or go back in time 6 years and play it when it comes out.

review:
If you are looking for a large scale RTS, this game is NOT for you.

If you want to control air, land, AND sea, this game is not for you.

If you want limited variety in troop type and faction, this game IS for you.


In other words, as an RTS, this game is horrible.  As a grand strategy involving massive amounts of units and big-picture tactics, this game as failed.  

I would only reccomend this game if you prefer to manage a small number (no more than 20 or 30) of each type of unit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153567653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1225, 'last_played': 1487419314}
review:
This version of CnC got quite a lot of flack from various thing. Listing some:
1.) This version of CnC greatly move in a different gameplay of RTS compare to other CnC. SO DIFFERENT. I pretty much understand those who say that the classic CnC gameplay is much  better since it was the one that they got to play since their childhood (Nostalgia factor is a plus). This version greatly rewarded those who knows a little bit of micro-managing (Especially those who are good in that matter). New gameplay, new strategies, new tactics.

2.) EA launch this game in Steam via 3rd party software, which you have to make an account with EA to play it. I got no problem doing that as I have a lot of games doing that in my Steam library, however the create new account link in launch program is broken, so you have to go directly to the site (minor inconvinience). Other thing, creating new account is pretty much a pain in the neck depending on your location, so I have to activate my VPN (Germany) to successfully make a new account. This could make those who are kinda not informed what VPN is lose interest in playing this game.

3.) You can not play this without internet connection, as you have to login everytime you launch this game. Big minus point.

I played this game until I finished GDI and NOD Brotherhood path. I quite say that I got the game mechanic and game play after few games (due to the fact that compare to other CnC, this version is like entirely another game). If you'll give it some time, it's enjoying. Hard and rewarding. Although the campaign was so short that if you have no other friend to play with, this gonna go lame very fast.

Oh, and a lot of people are rampantly cheating coz of weak-ass anti-cheat system of EA.

I recommend only getting this in bundle with the rest of CnC in Steam. Buying it alone is truly not worth the money.

review: i love CNC but i just hate being made to log in just to play a game it sucks,  what the heck what if i had no internet for a week or so you would not be able to play the game that sucks big time, shore its ok to register a game thats fair, but making us sign in every time is just not on, it make me wonder if it is being used as a tunneling app, and that scares me a little, i would under stand if i was playing multy play or co op.   but why do we need to be loged in to that web site to play a game we payed  steam for steam is all that we need to have turned on,  why do we need to be loged into ea.  wtf.  i feel snooped on and spyed apon and used to gain info, that is unsettling  and not at all needed to gain proof we payed for the game.  lol its a 4 doller game not a 200 doller game. and it is not eve online so why.  other than that i realy like the game it could use an over hall on the detail side, it feels like a game made to be played on a watch but was shiped out for pc lol  ( i do love the little movies that come along for the ride that is like a walk down memory lane,  it is worth the 4 doller i payed so i wont get a refund. and i might still recomend it yet )   ( if you make the new version please give us actual details we can zoom in on, if that happnes ill pay 30 doller or 40 doller but as it stands 4 doller is a good price

author: {'steamid': '76561198010023788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1485771692}
review:
DONT BOTHER!!!!

I cannot play this game. EA requires you to create an account with them to even run the game app. However, when you click on the Create Account button on the log in screen, you are taken to a 404 error, a webpage that no longer exists.

So I tried troubleshooting that for about 14 hours because I can be kind of a techie and try to solve my own problems. During that time, I kept closing and reopening the app or leaving that login screen up while I went to research the issue, attempt get tech support, poop, what have you. Now that the play time exceeds 2 hours as far as steam is concerned, STEAM WILL NOT GIVE ME A REFUND.

So I guess I paid 20 bucks to be able to see the game listed in my library. Huzzah. I really should have read the comments before buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036067529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1485806733}
review: Absolutely, under no circumstances, should you buy this game. Its a shit quasi-MOBA that tried to steal too much at once. The other C&C games are a completely diffent genre than this abomination. If you're looking for this kind of playstyle, go log onto Heroes of the Storm and play as Abathur. Its literally the same thing, only with better servers and support. I had high hopes for a command and conquer sequel, but EA decided to take the hopes and dreams of its fanbase, coat it in human feces and set it on fire. On a scale of one to ten, this game is gof*ckyourself/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125069733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1480168796}
review: Я в шоке как можно было запороть такую игру. Эта была одна из первых игр в которые я поиграл и впервые я поиграл в C&C 3 Tiberium Wars потом начал в Red alert играть и так далее потом вышла Ярость Кейна и мне ужасно понравилось новый вид бытвы добавили и всё такое жаль что компании за ГСБ не было но не суть. После всех частей пройденных мной а я прошел все игры серии C&C это нечто ужасное и скучное. Я даже проходить его не хотел, я просто хотел посмотреть концовку, я прошел 1 раз за Гди и 1 раз за Нод а остальные концовки посмотрел в инете. В общем не советую эту игру в ней нет ни постройки базы ни нормальных войск ни нормального геймплея как в предшествниках, действительно "Зачем нужна эта построй базы это же так сложно". Они этим убили всю игру и дерьмово закончили серию Tiberum wars. Я лудше другие часи в 100 раз перепроходить буду чем играть в это.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052386143', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1485706823}
review:
[h1]千万别买！千万别买！千万别买！就算1折都不要买![/h1]

本想体验下系列剧情的结局，玩了一会儿连优酷通关的想法都没了。

需要登陆EA账户才能开始游戏    -1
点击注册页面无效                      -1
挂VPN也没用                             -1
还好我有账号                            +1
我真希望我没有                          -1
倒退的游戏画面                          -1
披着RTS外皮的天知道什么游戏  -1
糟糕的游戏体验                          -1
屎一样的人口设定                       -1
.
.
.
.
.
.

总分：-∞/10

结论：辣鸡游戏，负分滚粗

author: {'steamid': '76561198042714887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1485567493}
review:
Basically EA does what it does best and ruins the game franchise "to open it to new players"

the simplified everything

infantry are singular units you can only get with defense mcv's
ground vehicles are offense mcv's
air is support mcv's

the amount of units that exist has been cut down to a huge extent, theres an at guy, anti infantry guy and anti air guy which pretty much sms up the rest of em

no heavy or light no special units oh no

to be quite blun this thing is a cartoonish caracature of what command and conquer should be.

The only good thing about this game is Kane but the writing for him is obviously lazy and you can tell, its really unfortunate.

Do not buy this game, i only got it as  a bundle in a sale

Fuck you EA, just fuck you

author: {'steamid': '76561198305345493', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1485309292}
review:
打过RA3的童鞋们应该看得出来，这代和RA3用的应该是一个引擎……
然而却远不如RA3好玩儿……（也许是我不太会微操把……）
为什么把RTS传统的造兵模式取消了……只留下一个令人蛋疼的主基地，和人口限制……
我很想说：“我需要更多的补给站……“
“不好意思我们没有补给站可以给你用……”
“我需要泰伯伦矿，或是晶体矿，哪怕是横在城市道路中央的矿井都可以！”
“不好意思，泰伯伦控制网络不让您采矿了，那些残余的晶体是您升级用的“
画面过得去，剧情没看完……
你问我为什么没看完？操作太蛋疼，单位经常犯傻站一边儿啥事儿不干还挡路。搞死别人的基地都要搞半天，断别人经济这一招也用不上了，多矿点工作用经济和兵力碾压对手也用不上了，这不是我要的RTS！
想玩SC2，CNC3甚至是RA3的那种即时战略的孩子们别想了，这不是你想要的东西！

review: На самом деле это очень интересная задумка, раазработчики хотели показать нам как C&С будет выглядит без основных построек, сооружений, и разных способностей. Если бы разработчики сделали название по другому, это возможно бы изменило все, например: C&C Revolution. Просто теперь для любителей и фанатов 4 часть ассоциируется с концом выпуска их любимой стратегии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073261021', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1567525124}
review:
Что ж, игра конечно неплохая, но я ожидал большего...
Да, всё в новинку, да всё красочно, НО:
1. Появилась такая ненужная и непонятная вещь, как Уровень, а это значит, что все юниты и постройки недоступны пока не достигнешь этого уровня (ЗАЧЕМ?!).
2. По сравнению с Red alert 3 интерфэйс сделали как бы удобнее (но нет), убрали возможность вынужденной атаки (она в принципе и не нужна была, но жалко), и опять-таки УРОВНИ не дают насладиться игрой.
3. По-видимому игру старались заточить под мультиплеер (И да, в ней есть люди, около 30 человек точно играют).
4. Кампания как-бы есть, но её как таковой НЕТ. Где красивые заставки как в Red Alert 3?!
В общем, я думал если меня КэК Red Alert 3 удивил, то эта игра тем более, как я ошибался... Хотя 224Р на неё не особо жалко... Игра сделала не революционный шаг вперёд, а скорей, споткнулась и откатилась на пару метров назад(Нет, я не наркоман). Она стала каким-то Star Craft-ом 2...
Крч 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099542550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482836411}
review:
Le plus mauvais C&C de tous les temps.

Je préfère même rejouer aux premiers de la série tant celui-ci propose un gameplay totalement aux antipodes des C&C comme on les aime ! 

Niveau graphisme ce jeu est limite, niveau gameplay c'est du cap & win en spammant les unités comme un abruti, pas de constructions possibles de batiments, progression de niveau global qui permet de créer seulement 1/3 des unités au début du jeu, se débloque par faction (donc nécessite la même stupide jauge à remplir pour les deux factions), seulement 2 factions jouables, le mode en ligne est impossible sans avoir tout débloqué car les autres joueurs vous feront les fesses...

Ce jeu est à éviter, je l'ai acheté dans le bundle en promo de C&C et très honnêtement je regrette sincèrement de l'avoir eu dedans, j'aurais préféré ne pas l'obtenir et passer à coté de cet étron tellement la désillusion est grande...

Même en promotion ce jeu ne mérite pas d'être acheté, l'intérêt d'un tel jeu est strictement réservé aux personnes qui aiment ce genre de jeux, certainement pas à ceux qui aiment C&C... Il s'agit bien la d'un jeu totalement différent, je le rappelle...

author: {'steamid': '76561198305952869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1527354114}
review: Mandatory EA account required. Locked out of most units until you have played the game enough to acquire arbitrary XP amount set by developers (even in skirmish mode). Inferior visual quality, animations, and gameplay when compared to C&C 3 (which is an earlier game by several years). Kane is no longer the Messiah. Tiberium saga ends with a wimper instead of a bang. Would not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 563, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 86400}
review: A once proud RTS series, reduced to a pathetic game of rock-paper scissors, with no tactics other then what counters what, and no resource management or base building. The only thing Tiberian Twilight has in common with the earlier entries in the series, even with the third game, is the presence of Joe Kucan as Kane- and the dead, empty look in his eyes tells you what you need to know. Avoid this game at all costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978144408', 'num_games_owned': 3127, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1498934043}
review:
不推荐。10分满分的话，我打5分（里边情怀占1分）。

18年的CNC也是结束了，从小玩红警长大，对这个系列感情很深，将军2胎死腹中之后，CNC4注定是系列的终点了，还真的没想到最终作是这么个奇行种……（虽然我断断续续好几年才把战役通了）

首先来说这个游戏的成品质量：
　　剧情基本烂片，制作完全没有3代的水准；地图非常糊弄，程序相当偷懒（地形与单位碰撞检测无语得想砸键盘，各种单位空气墙），大家都能看出来这款“正统续作”根本就不算是亲生的，不论哪一方面都在透露着低成本赶工骗情怀的嘴脸。

再来具体谈谈这游戏的玩法设计：
　　本作对系列前作来说都是颠覆性的变革——简化建造部分，极度控制人口（不禁想到了某些RTS探路失败作）。这一设计也是有一些优点的，那就是再也没有人海战术和后期一波推的路线，从而迫使玩家更加关注策略。
　　但这种看似新颖的玩火设计显然非常不成熟。
　　1.三种基地的选择更像是为了设计而设计，并没有完全突出三选一能带来的优势特点。选择路线后反而固定了套路，发展缺乏多样化，也失去了随时根据战局调整的可控性（虽然可以重新选择路线，不过只能在出生点降落的设计很让人绝望）。
　　2.在建筑直接砍掉的前提下，为了弥补游戏元素过少的不足，设计了并不精简的大量冗余兵种。兵种虽多，但由于人口的限制，游戏可控单位数量极少，以至于每个单位的兵种血量逆天，再加上极端的兵种克制，1个步兵被5辆坦克群殴10秒不死有时还能反杀的情况也是时常发生，不禁怀疑数值策划是不是在报复社会……

步子迈得太大容易扯到胯……大家RTS都玩微创新，不是没有道理，20多年积累下来的模式不是能轻易改变的。创新可以有，但在正统续作上实验，只能说胆识过人，但有勇无谋吧；市场和口碑的双重滑铁卢足以说明这是一次完全失败的冒险。

最后：怀念西木头。
（P.S. 光头的故事就这么随便结束了？不甘心！！！太TM糊弄事了吧！！！）

review:
With the new Steam Awards gimmick, I have proposed this as a contender for the  'Most Effective Franchise-Killer' award.

Good job all round.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973231518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
I really wanted to like this game.  

I enjoyed the other games in the C&C Tiberium universe, and the setting feels like a good continuation of that... but I just cannot get past the gameplay.  Screenshots and videos might be staged to make this look like it plays like other C&C games, but it really does not.  There is a big focus on small unit tactics, limited armies, micro-management, and territory control.  In truth, this would not make a bad PvP skirmish game, with short session times and persistant leveling to build an army.  Sadly, this model does not fit well with a single player campaign game, particularly if one expects a more traditional C&C experience.  

I might recommend this if you just wanted a skirmish game, but odds are anyone who wants that experience will go looking for something more dedicated to that purpose.  Anyone who comes to this looking for a traditional C&C game will come away disappointed.  I cannot recommend this title without major, major caveats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010822523', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1685723533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198155028013', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1474186470}
review: Я проходил 3 раза эту игру, только сегодня решил купить на сайте и хочу сказать следующее. Это конечно не C&C3, но поиграть в неё всё же стоит. Из минусов хочу отметить, что сюжет за ГСБ немного шлаковый, из-за того что полковник один раз не послушался генерала развязалась гражданская война + Кейн тоже козни устраивал во всём этом. Ещё один минус в простоте, раньше всё было труднее, но это и затягивало, уверен многие меня в этом поддержат. Следующий минус что твоя армия ограничена. Все минусы перечислять не буду. Если хотите сами всё увидете, но поверьте поиграть в неё стоит, хотя бы 1 раз. Плюсов я вообще не вижу, разве что графон лучше чутка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171399529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1472995190}
review:
When i was young i played C&C and seeing it on steam made me remember those times way back when...
Games back then were made to keep you there and were well crafted to give the player a feeling of accomplishment after you beat each level.

-breaths in
THIS P.O.S. REMINDS ME OF HOW BAD GAMES GET AFTER A BEATIFUL SERIES GOES UNDER!

what happened to building your base up and and having to mine for resorces while being gunned down by your enimies. what happened to kane being the coolest vilian ever in C&C. what happened to the stratagy that was suppose to be in this game. why do i hvae to level up to use my whole arsenal. why did they disable wasd as the camera controls, using the mouse and having to use shortcuts without having a place to start from on the keyboard sucks. the graphics are cool but why would developers EVER put graphics befor the story or game play.

this game is a flop and should just be buried along with E.T. in a big landfill.

this game is a horrible sequal to a grand series.

this game is the killer of the C&C Series.

the only way out is to make another red alert and the third one was pushing it. besides we are tired of red alert and ww2 based games; or at least i am.

good bye C&C this game just ended our relationship.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016493259', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1472948759}
review: Recomendo com ressalvas. Esqueça todos os jogos da franquia. Leva tempo pra aprender o novo sistema e mesmo que aprenda, pode ser que não agrade. Jogo diferente, com bons gráficos. Não devia se chamar command conquer. Só compre caso esteja barato, paguei 8 reais. O preço normal de 30 não compensa. Mas caso queira ver o final da história como eu fiz, seja feliz e vá de mente aberta para novas experiências. Caso seja purista, passe longe e vá pro RED Alert 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990209106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1472576532}
review:
Einfach mies,

so was schelchtes hab ich schon lange nicht mehr gespielt, ansich is das gameplay ja ganz lustig, aber es kommt einfach nicht richtig motivation zusammen.
das die einheiten aufsteigen, ist ja ganz schön, jedach merkt man so gut wie nichts davon, das sie irgendwie stärker werden oder sonstige verbesserungen.
für mich ist allerdrings das schlimmste, das man von den crawlern(gebäude zu einheiten bau) jeweils nur einen bauen kann, sprich off, def und supp, dadruch auch andere einheiten bauen kann/muss, man könnte den crawler wechseln während des spieles, was aber schwachsinn ist weil nur off was bringt, dazu schwankt der schwierigkeitsgrad von missionen so sehr das man meint, man hat was falsch eingestellt.
für mich ist das spiel leider ne große enttäuschung und was mich zu diesem review veranlasst hat war eigentlich nur eine einheit die dermaßen geärgert hat, das mir der kragen geplatzt ist.
wie kann man denn nen trupp ins spiel einbauen, wohlgemerkt fußeinheit, die einfach deine panzer übernimmt obwohl fast 10 panzer auf ihn schießen und während er dir dann das teil klaut is er einfach nich down zu kriegen, so nimmt er sich stück für stück und du schießt eigene einheiten kaputt, ich flüchte doch nicht über die halbe karte mit panzern vor "einer" verdammten einheit, unfassbar.
wobei 10 panzer auch übertrieben is man kann ja nur 50-60 einheiten bauen und kein trup flug oder fahrzeug kostet weniger als 3 größere sogar 6, da kommt also nich viel zusammen zudem braucht man immer genügend rep einheiten.
naja glücklicherweise hat's mich nur 2,50€ gekostet.

review:
Also: die ursprünglichen CnC waren rts und das lief super.
CnC4 ist im Skirmish eher ein erobern und halten, wie man es von anderen capture the flag her kennt. 

Ein CnC ist kein CnC nur weil CnC drauf steht. 

Mein Fazit (nach 2 Spielen im 2 gegen 2):
Wer Erobern und halten (ausschließlich) mag für den ist CnC4 eine alternative.
Für alle eingefleischten CnC Spieler ist CnC4 nicht das richtige. 

Siehe die anderen Kommentare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105957932', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1473830222}
review:
Я раньше писал что игра полная параша и не стоит брать. Так вот я полностью согласен с самим собой (а вы думали что-то измениться?)
Можно сказать что данная игра создана для ачивки "Потрачено" - (уже много подобных ачивок).

В граф плане довольно неплохо, а вот в GAYплейной части... предыдущие части были лучше и даже один человек написал:
 "Посмотри на третью часть и поменяешь своё мнение." - Terrifying_Metal 
Если тройки нет на аке это не значит что я в нее не играл и не знаю что там с ней.
Я в третью много наиграл времени и очень... СВЕРХ точно скажу "Она раком нагнет эту часть" по всем параметрам.

Стоит брать?
Скажу сразу и без.. ох посмотрите в окно! Там люди ходят.... так... 
А! Игру не трогайте, даже палкой опасно касаться... лучше обойдите этот мертвый вонючий кусок Г.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029034576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1352275200}
review:
DO NOT BUY. I am a big Command and Conquer fan this game is just a big steaming pile of whale blubber, spending $19.99 is too generous for this game.

Cons:
No more base builder
Stupid and short story
$19.99 as a price tag
Does not feel like a true Command and Conquer game
Did I mention took away build a base and no longer need to farm resources

Pros:
Makes you really want to play and love Command and Conquer 3 , Generals , Red Alert.
Invest your money in a better Command and Conquer and not this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986596613', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 7029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6932, 'last_played': 1655006512}
review:
Okay, it's a good game, I like it, but if it's the Command & Conquer series you're hoping to find playing this, you're going to be disappointed.
I love the concept of having a support/defence/offense mobile bases.
You have to collect tiberium by simply picking it up, which is weird. You have an insanely low limit of units and defense if you're playing with someone, even if alone.
I like the game, but it shouldn't have been a part of the C&C series

author: {'steamid': '76561198022481570', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 10857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2834, 'last_played': 1705522931}
review:
Убить нахуй башкой об стену тех, кто бездумно заминусовал игру. Да, изменена концепция игры, сделан упор на микро-контроль, что весьма не плохо. Конечно отсутствие строительства распугало псевдо "фанов" C&C. Эти любители C&C 3 кукарекующие про легкость новой части, сами в большинстве своем не смогли пройти и пару уровней кампании. Эти любители C&C 3 даже не играли в Tiberium Dawn или Tiberium sun. Эти люди еще пытаются что то писать. Большинство плохих обзоров написано в 2010, эти аутисты еще не готовы были узнать, каким говном будет Generals 2(зато по пожеланиям тех самых любителей С&С 3). Хейт идиотов не готовых к новым концепциям положил конец C&C как таковому, разрабы уже бояться что то делать из-за хейта. Я сам олдфаг, и знаю все о C&C. Почему меня так не бомбит на новою концепцию, и почему ауты так дрочат на упрощенный C&C 3, где нет половины механики, что есть в Tiberium Sun. ХЕЙТ-НАХУЙ, игра годная, ауты не смогли в микро-контроль и ноют. Посмотрел бы я на них, и как бы они сосали в Tiberium Dawn.
P.S. В игре отличная оптимизация, это вам не релиз в 25 фпс в раннем доступе стима. В свое время игра запускалась на довольно допотопных "корчах".
P.P.S. Люди пишущие про примитивность смотрят за передвижениями "кучек" в SC2. Шутка про F2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277247864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1707918476}
review:
It would be hard to say whether this game shall be recommended or not, I will say 5/10. BUT DO NOT WASTE MONEY ON IT. 

Pros:
-Fun new units and elements to test and greater visuals comparing to CC3. The plot may be too short but is reasonable. Blue tiberium core upgrades are fun to try out. 
-Great, epic music.

Cons:
-Cartoonish visual effects, an unpleasant retrogress to the realistic CC3 feeling.
-Very short campaign length. The only bonus campaign require preorder, but it was 6 years ago and unable to download or purchase via DLC. 
-Scrins did not come back as it was assumed, which disappointed many players. 
-Gaming balance is totally destroyed. Weapon types have be significantly simplified and units turned out to be lot harder to kill, which require lesser micros and strategies for good matches. 
-Need no resource to produce units. It is a very controversial change, as it makes no sense.
-Require online network for gaming, but afaik EA is going to shut it down someday nevertheless.

Personally I do not disagree with this new yet controversial building quenes applied in this game, but producing units without the need of resources simply won't make sence for gaming balance and result in lot of TR vs. TR

Guess EA won't continue on CC anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184070898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1482162201}
review:
So I am a massive fan of the Command and conquer games and I heard about this game and simply had to try it, something i regret. First off this is not a sequal to an amazing game this is barley even command and conquer. There is no base building, no resource gathering, the community is dead, and this game is SO over priced its not even worth your time as a F2P game, and im one of the suckers that got tricked into buying it for 20 bucks, yeah i feel real stupid, please please please do not buy this game take that 20 dollars and buy one of the previous games in the series that is a true command and conquer game this is not CnC this is EAs attempt to squeeze as much money out of a game as they possibly can. And wtf is wrong with the Super dedicated Rock Paper Sissors style of units? it would be fine if they had COUNTER UNITS that could take on 2 diffrent types at once but there isn't its all just one unit ment to counter another no versatility and that breaks the game it means you just wasted alot of time building one type of unit to counter what you thought the enemy had only to realize he changed his army and before you say OH JUST BUILD A BUNCH OF DIFFRENT UNITS that won't work because you really do need an army of one type of unit to have any impact on the enemy, you could use that stratigy like i tried to but it simply fell apart and i was fighting bots at the time, the class system was interesting for 2 minutes till i found out aggressive support or campy defense is the best way to win. Here are my pros and cons

Pros (the few the proud)
Its a newer take on a stratigy game.

It adds new units to the game.

Works well enough with friends.

I had no lag issues and minimal game crashs.

Fast unistall.

Cons (here we go)
Nothing like any of the other CnC games so I simply can't label it as CnC.

There are no counter units meaning you just have to guess what the enemy is building and build units accordingly.

No base building and no resource gathering which is the corner stone of the CnC universe in terms of gameplay.

Some units are either broken op or so underwelming its just stupid (like the commandos that used to be badass).

Its way over priced.

Gameplay is increadably repetative.

Graphics are subpar to say the least.

The story is the weakest the CnC series has ever had.

If you do play with people its either a steam rolling support that focuses damage or rushing assault. 

There is no balancing in my opinion between the classes. 

No more fight the enemy to the death its now just who can get the most points by capturing points of intrest around the map ( the very limited amounts of maps).

Slow install.

Summary
EA once again found a series everyone loved and worrshipped and decided to destroy is for the sake of money the game is simply not fun its over priced its not CnC, I understand a game needs to evolve but you do need to keep those core elements in the game that make it that game something the devs don't understand and btw at this point in time the game is hacker central so if you do for some reason decide to buy this game have fun with that. 2/10 DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016097977', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1432989777}
review:
Kane ist tot - Kane lebt - leider ist er der einzige, der noch etwas mit Command & Conquer zu tun hat.

Nach vielen Jahren habe ich mir für 5 EUR dieses letzte Puzzlestück zu der tollen Tiberium-Reihe gekönnt, allen Unkenrufen zum Trotz... War ich seit Alarmstufe Rot völlig begeistert und habe seit den späten 90er Jahren alle C&C samt Addons regelmäßig gerne gespielt - sowohl die Missionen, als auch im Mehrspieler-Geplänkel.

RA 1 +2Addons - strategisch eines der besten
RA 2 +1Addon - das witzigste und einfachste zu "Modden" und mit FA2 zu "mappen"
RA 3 +1Addon - hier schlägt es schon eine seltsame Richtung ein, allerdings gibt es eine super Mod, die Alarmstufe Rot 1 quasi auf die neue Engine portiert - top.
TD +1Addon - muss ich sagen, hat mich nie so begeistert, die Mechanik in RA war besser. Storytechnisch aber auch gut.
TS +1Addon - sowohl TiberianSun, als auch Firestorm sind meine absolute Favoriten, da strategisch mehr niemals mehr geboten wurde. Ver#nderbares Terrain, Untergrundeinheiten etc. Geiles Spiel - auch heute noch.
TW +1Addon - Meiner Meinung nach ist das der letzte Teil, der Tiberium-Saga, sowohl Storymäßig als auch grafisch und von der Mechanik. Die Dystopie aus TS/FS fehlt leider manchmal, aber dennoch ein sehr gutes Spiel.
Renegade und Generals lasse ich mal außen vor, da erstes ein FPS und zweites ein relativ realistisches gutes RTS-Game ist, aber mit CnC ebenfalls nicht wirklich etwas gemein hat.

=== Command & Conquer IV - Tiberian Twilight ===

Nach drei Stunden bereuhe ich den Kauf und möchte nicht mehr alles wiederholen, was bereits x Mal geschrieben wurde....

Kurzum:
Alles(!) was Command & Conquer ausgemacht hat, fehlt hier. Zwar wurde das seinerzeit zu Generals auch gesagt, doch Generals war ein echtes RTS - was man von TiberianTwilight nicht mal behaupten kann. Drei Produktionsstätten und irgendein mit XP-Punkten versehende Logik um Einheiten (begrenzt) bauen zu können. Wäre kein Joe C. "Kane" anwesend, in den wenigen Sequenzen, wüsste man nicht, dass man ein CnC in Händen hält.

Dämlich, nicht mal 5 EUR wert. Traurig, dass der gute Name von den Westwood Studios für dieses Machwerk missbraucht wurde. Wo CnC nun steht, wissen wir - im Regal bzw. als billiger Abklatsch als Free-To-Play-Variante...

author: {'steamid': '76561198036096661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1325491200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120068901', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1554596460}
review:
Comprei porque sou Fã da franquia C&C desde PS1

De todos os C&Cs que já lançaram e que eu já joguei esse é de longe o único que não tem nada haver com a franquia, alias não devia nem ter o titulo de C&C, o modo skirmish que era tão foda de ficar batalhando entre as A.I para tentar derrotar todas e controlar o mapa todo agora virou um modo estilo Conquest, não tem coleta de recurso igual seus antecessores, o sistema de upgrade é uma Me#$% foge completamente do contesto de um jogo RTS na qual somente upando de level que você consegue liberar tropas e tecnologias, você pode escolher entre 3 classes(defense, support e offense) para jogar e com diferentes unidades cada classe, necessário estar online sempre e caso a conexão cair você perde todo o progesso, fico triste ao saber que uma franquia tão memorável como C&C acabou tomando o rumo errado e teve esse fim completamente decepcionante .

Essa é minha opinião, fique livre para criticar e opinar.

Às vezes fico pensando se tal rumo não tivesse sido tomado quantos C&Cs já teriam sido lançados e quais seriam seus títulos tipo ex: C&C: Origins of Scrin, C&C: The Battle for Earth, C&C: The other race.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041121387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1434770918}
review:
Why fix what ain't broken? Seriously. EA killed the series. 

Cons: 
1. No base building/ tiberium harvesting= loss of the rts feel. What I mean by this is that 4 is more for the starcraft spam multiplayer than anyone else. Without base building or real tiberium harvesting where every purchase is much more impacting in the long meta of a mission, everything here becomes a rock paper scissors contest of what you can deploy to counter 1 to 2 enemy crawlers. Without base building the story also seems totally rushed.
2. The story is terrible. Either way you end up really lossing and with the worst cliff hanger that implies EA not progressing the story past this game. Its like we began with Turtledove, rich in universe detail and description with Tiberium Dawn thru tiberium sun while forgoing character development. then in 3 we hit an SM Stirling kind of narrative with really indepth background about the universe, annecdotes about characters like Havoc from Renegade, and crazy battlefields like red zones and yellow. Then we hit this...this slop. If you are here for the story I suggest you find it elsewhere for Tiberium Twilight will make you hate yourself. 
3. Multiplayer is stupid unbalanced due to unit unlocks versus experience. If you're a new player online prepare to have your first majority of battles to be like Dark Souls; lots of death and much frustration as you have tier I and maybe tier II while your opponent has tier III and more. It's going to be a bad time. hint just rush support. Air OP. 
4. Still too expensive for how bad it is. 

Pros: 
1. Kane is back. Kane backstabs GDI. 
2. Scrin towers actually are explained.
3. Missions are generally quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040391918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1463546969}
review: So i've loved Command & Conquer for years, since i was just a kid, but after playing a good hour of this i realized how much the original makers had to sacrifice to give what they could in this final installment. Every new game should have things that make you feel like it's new, and they've gotten feedback, worked with ideas, and have dished out the best they could come up with. This game, saddly, feels like an RTS rendition of a game from the early 2000's. I really wish those who worked on the game had the money and/or cared enough to make this last installment a great success, and a game that would leave a good lasting memory from a series that was the foundation of the childhoods of severl individuals. Fuck EA. I'm so enraged that i care little to look over my comment for any errors.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963216916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4141, 'last_played': 86400}
review: I love the C&C series but this game is everything wrong with the triple A world. Take a game of base building and unit tactics and make the bases mobile and units unlock as you level up. Also giving bland control points is a patronizing pat on the head to the RTS fans that can tell what is important in a map to control.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995210926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
This is the worst game I've ever played.  It haunts me, sitting in my steam lists, even uninstalled.  This was the death-knell of Command & Conquer, a venerable franchise that spanned many great games over a decade, and it is physically painful to know it ends with this.  

This game is a failure on every level.  I bought it on sale out of morbid curiosity, and I regret that decision.  Do not make my mistake.

review:
This has to be about the worst C&C title there is... No, I take that back, IT IS THE WORST.  It's like taking the concept of Unreal Tournament with the "spawn, run, kill, die, repead" mentality and popping it into a "stratigy" game.  There is no stratigy in either.  Basically make troops, toss them to their doom and repeat.  No real base building, no real stratigy, get C&C 3, or 2...

I have no idea what crack rock they smoked to come up with this game but it was some bad stuff mang.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029761543', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1522880306}
review:
Si vous êtes fan de la série C&C, n'acheter pas cet opus, car vous allez être aussi triste que si on vous dit que vos parents sont morts. Le plus gros problème selon moi est l'absense total d'un vrai gameplay de C&C comme on aime.

Premièrement, les unités ne vienne pas de la même façon que les autres opus. Dans cette merde, vous devez montez votre niveau global du jeu pour avoir les meilleurs unités et améliorations d'unités. Donc si vous êtes nouveau à ce jeu et que vous jouez en ligne contre un joueur niveau max, vous allez en chier une bonne. En plus, votre niveau ''global'' n'est pas vraiment global, car votre lvl augmente seulement dans la faction dont vous jouez. C'est à dire que si vous jouez avec le GDI, le Nod va rester à son niveau actuel. 

Deuxièmement, vous n'avez QU'UNE SEULE structure. Vous ne pouvez pas construire par exemple des centrales pour votre énergie parce que vous en avez pas besoin. Les seules structure qu'on peut fabriquer sont les tourelles et autres défenses. Autrement dit, tout ce fait avec votre unique base (appelé Crawler) : création d'unité, amélioration, etc... et sérieusement, je trouve cela vraiment médiocre.

Finalement, le truc qu'on a tous besoin dans tous les RTS est bien sûr la gestion des ressources. Dans ce jeu, il n'y en a pas. Le tiberium, seule ressource du jeu, n'existe plus. D'accord j'avoue qu'il en a encore dans le jeux, mais ça sert seulement à faire avancé vos amélioration plus rapidement. les parties ressemblent plus à du spam de création d'unité. La stratégie n'existe plus dans C&C 4.

Pour conclure, ce jeu est mauvais. Il y a d'autre chose que je n'ai pas parlé comme la sorte de classe que vous pouvez prendre: attaque, défense et soutien. Je trouve cette idée vraiment nulle, parce que vous n'avez pas toutes les variations d'unité (exemple : pour avoir des unités aériennes il faut être soutien). Franchement, j'avais acheté cet opus seulement pour connaître le reste de l'histoire, mais j'ai pas réussi à le finir à cause du gameplay pourri qui me dégoûte. Même en rabais je le déconseille. Ce jeu est la définition même de la déception.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048574801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 5733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1458947161}
review:
Not only is this game the biggest piece of rubbish ever created, but it does one of the most unethical things.  After exiting the game it keeps itself "running" on steam to falsely increase the hours played.  I played this for only 30 minutes and it says 95 hours now.

Avoid this junk like the plague.  It is poorly put together and has no bearing on the command and conquer universe.  This game is honestly worse quality than bad cell phone games.

A total rip-off.  Useless.  Rubbish.  Junk.  No redeeming feature whatsoever.  Trash.  Excrement.  Makes me want to vomit.

0 / 10

review:
Big Red Alert fan here.

Did not enjoy this at all. I understand that sometimes a developer wants to do something new but this was too detached from the previous games IMO. Combat was slow, and I never felt like I was achieving much. 

I think RTS died a bit of a death some time ago, and this kind of cemented that for me.

review: редкостный кал, благо она досталась в нагрузку решил наконец пройти 4 часть, посмотреть вкусные ролики и насладиться стратегией... ииии что я увидел - кусок говна на ножках перемещается по карте и крафтит ограниченное кол-во юнитов, да еще и базу норм не обстроешь, потому как тебе дают выбрать одну из трех избушек на курьих ножках(типо база), которые в свою очередь специализируются на чем-то одном и ты дрочишь часами передвигая базу и юнитов, любителям дотки понравится. для фанатов C&C - не берите, разочаруетесь сразуже. хреновее этой игры я не видел...

author: {'steamid': '76561198047561668', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1386446985}
review:
Глупое и дешевое во всем начиная с главного меню, и заканчивая фирменными роликами с живыми актерами надругательство над великой классикой, которое позиционирует себя как "Эпичной завершение серии"
Плохо все: пятикопеечные анимации, наркоманский дизайн юнитов, невменяемая механика. Термины "баланс" и "глубина" тут даже рядом не валялись. Музыка  - алхай-малхай, алалэй, и монотонная оркестровая тоска. Сюжет и ролики отвратительны.

Надеюсь когда серию решат воскресить, про это позорище забудут.
P.S.
Бедный Джо Кукан.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165789112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1438609145}
review: "Эпилог". Часть, похоронившая серию. Ммм, эти тупые кардинальные изменения в геймплее, уничтожившие весь игровой процесс, к которому шла серия. Но это только вершина айсберга. Вершина бреда - сюжет игры. Какие-то сопли. Кейн, некогда водивший за нос всё ГСБ (вспомнить хотя бы 3-ю тибериевую войну, применение ионных орудий, ставка на Бойла, подрыв Главного Храма и т.д.), теперь творит какую-то дичь. Легион пропал куда-то. Его больше Нет. Куда делись Избранники? Кто такой Кейн? Что стало с миром Скринов? И многие другие вопросы задавали поклонники серии, а Electronic Arts сказали: "Ребята, идите нaxep! Вы получите сопливую мелодраму с бредовым сюжетом и таким же бредовым геймплеем, не ответившую ни на один вопрос." Вот так работают EA. Я удивлён, что не было хреналион платных дополнений, микротранзакций, цены на игру 5000 и т.п.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974328195', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1432600171}
review:
Bordel, je suis déçu ... mais genre, ils ont enterré le titre Command and Conquer ...

Je suis fan de la saga, j'ai eu le premier du nom sur playstation vers 1997 ...

Mais là, non, déjà, la durée de vie ... ouh la vache, t'en as pas pour ton fric, vraiment pas. Limite, ça vaut 5€ ...

Le jeu dure à peine 7h, j'ai voulu tester le multi, c'est aussi vide que les paroles d'un ministre ...

Tu es content de voir Kane sur la belle cinématique (d'ailleurs, il n'y a que ça de beau à vrai dire) ...

Le RTS qu'était Command and Conquer vient de se prendre un lifting complètement à côté de la plaque, à 6 années lumières de ce que doit être command and conquer: un jeu de stratégie en temps réel, où la conception d'unités est aussi importante que la conception de la base, la gestion des ressources ...

Ici, vous avez ... 3 mega-méca que vous pouvez appeler un à la fois (c'est votre véhicule de construction mobile), chacun a sa propre spécialisation, donc ses propres unités ... donc c'est mort, c'est nul, putain rendez-nous les canons à Ions, les bombes atomiques, les unités lance-flammes, les commandos avec leur phrase fun genre "Tiens, j'ai un petit cadeau pour toi".

Merde, non

Je retourne me calmer sur Command and Conquer Generals, je vais aller construire 300 chars juste pour les voirs s'éparpiller sur la carte et tirer sur ce qu'ils peuvent.

Puis je construirai une douzaine de canon à Ions et je vais faire des dessins sur la face de mes ennemis.

Non, n'achetez pas cet opus ... vous serez déçu ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198095549662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1439801542}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067511907', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1456100395}
review:
i get what ea's trying to do by mixing stuff up in order to "revolutionize" the genre, but really they murdered it and took away the one thing that made command and conquer unique and fun: base building.

sometimes its better that things dont change and stay the way they are instead of changing stuff around so much.

multiplayer is complete garbage and skirmish isn't as fun as other CNC, havent touched campaign. soundtrack's alright (especially Nod's)

offense is basically if you wanna kill people. i like playing support because aircraft and support powers. as for defense its the closest thing you'll get to base building since basically your crawler is your mobile, terrible base. 
expect to play a LOT of games in order to get all the high tier units and level up. yeah....

author: {'steamid': '76561198283283330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1455265959}
review: Absolutely nothing like Command and Conquer should be. Wish I did some research into what the game actually was. I'd personally say the C&C series should be embarassed to have this title wearing its name. Horrible interface, shoddy graphics and nothing what a C&C RTS interface should represent. No real base development or resource gathering interaction, just a slapped together quick point and click time waster that is better suited to be offered in a phone APP store, not a PC title. Definitely dissapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191263907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1505120980}
review:
The skirmish is decent though it's quite different from that in CNC series, kinda reminds me of the Colosseum.

The campaign, however, is extremely rediculous in the following aspects:
[olist]
    [*]For a new-player, you really shouldn't begin with the Campaign, since you need to unlock some crucial units to complete a specific level.
    [*]The lack of variety. Generally there's only one tactic  towards a campaign.
    [*]A bit more difficult even for senior-players of  CNCs.
[/olist]
In that, no one deserves this. But if you are a fan of CNC and fond in RTS arena, try this just as well...
