author: {'steamid': '76561198025143729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1634225523}
review:
This is not your typical C&C by any means, the rumors say that this was EA's attempt to push C&C to eSports, but because market was overwhelmed by MOBAs and other quality RTS games, they decided to slap 4 and ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE story on it to lure in loyal C&C fans, and the final product we have now does look and play exactly like it was initially planned to be. The only reason i give this game a positive rating is because i had a tons of fun and positive memories playing it with my friends in coop/compstomp and just skirmish with AI. If you play this game without thinking about past C&C games, it's actually fine, runs great, plays great, looks great. Let's do a breakdown :

Reasons to buy it [b][i]( only if it's on huge sale[strike] and you are desperate[/strike] )[/i][/b] :

 - Tons of fun in COOP with friends or vs AI alone.
 - Very pretty environmental/map design.
 - Sometimes it's very challenging.
 - Visuals.
 - 5v5 players possible.

Reasons to avoid it and tell me that i am stupid for giving it a positive rating :

 - Abysmal plot written by a madman in a few hours. Probably taken from DeviantArt fanfiction section.
 - Questionable units design.
 - Horrible FMV actors performance.
 - There is almost no way to beat campaign alone, it's designed to be beaten in COOP.
 - Unit cap.
 - Has almost nothing to do with C&C, hence no base building or tiberium harvesting.
 - The ending cutscene ( which is the finale of whole C&C series presumably ) is so horrible that you might want to kys after it.
 - Most of the super/special weapons feel weak.
 - You need to unlock units in order to use them.


If reasons to avoid it don't scare you + it's on a huge sale and you have a friend to play it with - then you might want to get it just for collection and full playthrough with people you know. If you're looking for extra content for it - don't. Game doesn't have mod support, but it does have few custom maps.

But if you want some more good old C&C - don't get it, it's not C&C, it won't be fun for you, infact it might leave you with few dead brain cells, just like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013932889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1453725641}
review:
DO NOT BUY! GAME IS NO LONGER PLAYABLE!

EA have since discontinued support of this trash game meaning that the CD registration servers and account registration servers for the Always online DRM no longer exist. Therefore you will not be able to launch the game beyond the pregame start up screen.

You're lucky though, This game was the trash that brute forced EA's patented studio/game series killing nails into the sweet price C&Cs coffin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983615838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1453501535}

author: {'steamid': '76561198203080353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1516931524}
review:
My original review in Jan 2016 was very negative due to the game simply not working and so I got a full refund from steam.
In Nov 2017, I paid 63 cent for the game in a sale and it worked fine once I'd input the game key, created a profile at EA games and logged in and played for a couple of hours... here's what I found:

The UI is a thing of nightmares and so full of glitches, you'd need Yuri Prime's psychic ability to directly access the developers mind on how it works.
The game perspective is so near, with a zoom so limited, that you can only go from viewing nasal hair, out to the blackheads covering the nose of a particularly grubby Zone-trooper.
Not that viewing the game is necessary as only being able to produce a handful of units, buildings, etc. due to the tiny resource caps, that you may as well keep the mouse button constantly clicking to make new units as the old ones get destroyed as soon as they emerge.
As for unit capabilities, you can go from nerf to fluffy kitten in a single bound, rendering the entire enterprise as challenging as going for a poo having eaten six buckets of yogurt.
Not that you should bother playing the game at all, as the concept of game-play seems to have eluded the developers who must have been so high on LSD they thought a table leg was interesting.
Thinking on it, I'm embarrassed for the video actors, some of who were in previous C&C incarnations and acted their hearts out in this one, only for it to be a total disgrace.
Oh and by the way – I WANT MY 63 CENT BACK!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128742044', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1451909404}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4056, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1605940661}
review:
Having played this game before, I personally would not suggest this game to a Command & Conquer fan because the game is way too different, for example, there's no more base building anymore, the game could be good if it would at least have that.
The Scrins were In my opinion, a nice addition to the Command & Conquer Tiberian series but they decided not to add it on this game which is pretty dumb In my opinion.
You should buy this game only if you tell yourself that this game is NOT a Command & Conquer and if you you don't care about this game not being complexe, the game's pretty easy actually unlike the previous games.
It could have been great but It is not, It feels like they've rushed everything about this game.
4/10
Hopefully we'll see some new Command & Conquer games that are good and much more like the previous ones and hopefully no online DRM or Origin crap...
But wait... It won't happen so I'd simply suggest you to play the older Command & Conquer games that are unfortunately only on Origin (except for Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wrath, Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath, Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3 and Command & Conquer Red Alert 3 - Uprising.
Not counting this one because this game is NOT a Command & Conquer game.
Command & Conquer 3: Red Alert was not as great as the previous ones but they are still fun unlike this, you're not too sure what to do with it after having finishing it at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050586106', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1449520535}
review:
If ur expecting a game similar to the older ones, this will fuck u.
U have ur small base, trops and stuff, there is three types of bases u can choose (And switch to in game)
Attack - Attack units (Tanks)
Defence - Footsoldiers, for bunkers and attack. and towers/bunkers.
Suport - Units, mostly repair/heal. some attack. Powers - repair, clocking and stuff (global)

There is a lvl system, so to play with others prepair to grind your way to lvl 20.
They dont even let u join costum games if youre low lvl.

Campain is kinda stupid.
Do this task - get constantly attacked.
You are overrun constantly by shit, and as far as i can tell, GDI campain seems easier than Nods.
Difference between Easy and normal aint that big.
Its practikaly the same, One map there spawned one few less mega tanks to attack me.
Another there spawned few less air suport for a target.

Not saying im bad, well might be true to thou. But ur so limited.

Sure whould be fun to play costom, but theres so few games and they dont let u join. (since i havent grinded enugh and not finished the boring campain yet)

Dont recomend it. If it aint broke dont fix it, and they broke the game. Loved the old RTS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069877806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1451170651}
review:
That is a sad truth that both players and the C&C series itself have been stripped off of its well deserved proper ending. EA created a chimera (apparently trying to take likeness of the other RTS titles) forgetting that this game has been an icon and should not be so awfully transformed. Thus dies C&C from house Westwood.

Adding injury to insult the new hybrid of a game is not even enjoyable to play. Tactics and strategy were limited to just positioning your mobile base and produce produce produce units. No money means just keeping the number of units at maximum and trying to utilize their not so useful abilities to win a mini skirmish after another in hope of reaching the mobile (sic!) enemy base to destroy it. The process gets boring after an hour of gameplay. On easy, the AI is practically dormant. On normal, computer produces units all the time that it becomes overwhelming.

I won't rate multiplayer as I dont care about it. I wanted a good and fitting story to end a legendary plot. What did we get? A slap in the face. They might as well just put the credits at the beginning and be done with it. A MAJOR disappointment. I hope someone picks up the torch where C&C 3 left it. Kane WILL be back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030325973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1408824897}
review:
Если вы хотите раз и навсегда разочароваться в RTS 
Если вы страдаете от своей любви к стратегиям и не можете играть в шутеры или любые другие жанры игр
Если вас привлекает БДСМ но всегда боялись попробовать
Если вам нравится аутичный стиль игры 
Если ваш ребенок увлекся компьютерными играми и забросил учебу  
Если вы окончательно разочаровались в человечестве и ищите дно и глубину его падения
ЭТА ИГРА ДЛЯ ВАС

Плюсы:

Завершение истории не смотря на кучу оставшихся вопросов

Наличие мозга не обязательно

Лысина Кейна

Панацея от игровой зависимости

Незабываемый опыт  - ДА игра действительна вызывает эмоции. Боль, гнев, чувство бесконечного осознания собственной ничтожности и важности твоего мнения как потребителя для злобных корпораций. Всю прелесть космических путешествий,изучения и познания нашей вселенной на личном транспортном средстве - горящая жо"па. Действительно не то что ты мог ожидать от развлекательной продукции, но хей по крайней мере это не бездушный трипл А а игра дарящая эмоции. 

Что бы зайти в игру нужно конкретно потрудится с регистрациями итд итп в случае переустановки еще и проблема с повторной активацией продукта казалось огромный минус и не удобство НО я верю что компания ЕА заботится о вашем здоровье и всячески усложняет вам доступ к этому продукту потому записываю в плюс

Возможность скипнуть заставку ЕА

Минусы:

Не игра - ЭТО прошло контроль качества кампании EA что очень пугает меня даже спустя 5 лет

Нет экономики - да во многих играх ее нет но там хоть есть игра

Краулеры - Есть 3 вида атакующий и 2 бесполезных

Разделение шагалок - кроме бесполезности всего кроме атакующего нет возможности комбинировать войска каждая шагалка рожает только один род войск тоесть по факту у вас даже не передвижная база а ТОЛЬКО военный завод\казарма\аэродром

Армия - Лимит юнитов смехотворен и странное чувство что в 95 я мог построить больше юнитов чем в 2010 не давало покоя.

Геймплей - вся игра сводится к тому что нужно дойти до места и родить юнитов, в случае если задача уничтожить врага нужно сесть своей хреновиной рядом с вражеской и смотреть как две херовины рожают юнитов в жалких попытках уничтожить друг друга

Динамичность - поймите меня правильно смотреть как два юнита стреляют друг в друга по 2 минуты не то что бы увлекательное действие 

Вторичность - в каждой серии игры так или иначе был виден технологический прогресс человечества за время нашего отсутствия но видимо в ЕА решили что "нет игры - нет прогресса" и юниты не то что бы изменились с момента 3 части большенство из них стали даже хуже. Видимо с момента последней войны все малость подзабили на тех обслуживание или типа того) нет конечно же некоторые юниты кочуют по играм серии с первой части но даже в них чувствуется развитие технологий. Тут нам предлогают все тоже самое + штучную пехоту( что на мой взгляд конкретный шаг назад на фоне 3 части)
Так же и замут с протоганистом искуственным интелектом как то в этот раз не зашел.
А глядя на полоски захвата стратегических пунктов упорно пытаешься найти значки Альянса и Орды
Однообразные задачи на протяжении всей игры которые прекрасно дополняют однообразный геймплей

Дегродация качества  - У нас в 3 части был в полне приличный перевод даже названия GDI(ГСБ)Глобальный Совет Безопасности и вообще качество работы Актеров озвучки на весьма приличном уровне. Актерам озвучки видимо давали сначало демо версию игры ибо желания работать (а может быть даже и жить) в их творчестве не чувствуется. В этой  поделке видимо даже локализаторы прошли контроль качества EA(Вместе со сценаристами, и тем человеком который решил отказатсья от основ C&C и переработать из стратегии в говно И мужик который накурил всех паленым красным тиберием...и секретарша которая не дала босу и он решил отомстить человечеству создав ЭТО в волнующем приходе от красного) - ибо только им одним ведомо как то же самое GDI(ГДИ) расшифровать адекватному русскоязычному человеку. Выдать говно за игру. Раскрутить ее так что люди это купят. И впервые в жизни не соврать с названием - это действительно закат....

Знаком с предыдущими продуктами серии - без коментариев просто плачу о покинувшей нас серии 

Стоимость - они хотят денег за то что убили великую RTS  и в итоге превратили ее в ср"ную браузерку

Оценка: Сотрите мне память из 10

This is a horrible end to a great series. I couldnt even play the second mission, it was sadly just that bad. THe graphics are horribly downgraded. The armor system is horrible, they removed base building from a base building game. You have to unlock90% of th eunits you would use in game. And the gam eplay is closer to top down tactics and not a true strategy.
On the plus side, oh wait there isn't one.

All I can say is this game was a huge disappointing way to end the tiberium storyline, the familar C&C controls including base biuliding are now gone and replaced with some sort of moving base which spawns units at a cost. 

Summarised in one one, BAD!

review: While I love all C&C games, this one kind of bites the bullet...the game play is more mobile than any of the previous ones, there is no base building, there are no super weapons. You have a central mobile base that builds units and are capped based on how many/what type of units you currently have active. If you are new to the C&C universe, DO NOT start here. Go with one of the more classic ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006560453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1447324389}
review:
[h1]TL;DR? See Conclusion[/h1]

[h1]NOTE: Related Content[/h1]
Also see my:
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars Review[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/24810]Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath Review[/url]

[h1]INTRODUCTION:[/h1]
Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight is a real-time strategy game developed and published by Electronic Arts. This title serves as the official sequel to the critically acclaimed C&C 3: Tiberium Wars  and acts as the final chapter in the decade and a half long Command & Conquer Tiberian franchise.

[h1]PLOT (No Spoilers):[/h1]
The story picks up 15 years after the end of Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath. The Scrin has been defeated, Kane has successfully recovered the Tacitus and the Brotherhood of NOD is merely a shadow of its former self. Despite the Scrin's failed invasion, all is not well as Tiberium now spreads in an ever more rapid rate and human extinction is almost inevitable. The game starts with Kane offering the remaining world leaders a solution to this problem.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ Return of live action cinematics but...(See CON #1)
+ Good sound effects and voice acting
+ Interesting veterancy system with visual upgrade changes for each level of veterancy
+ Good special effects and graphics (but average art style)
+ Interesting new units

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=522954423]Poor costume quality for the live action cutscenes[/url]
- No base building
- No resource gathering
- DRM Stacking (Always Online + Log-in requirement every time you start the game)
- Unlock and account level up system that ruins the game's unit availability: (meaning you can't jump to multiplayer immediately because half of your units are locked.)
- Population Cap
- The game is lore deficient, with a rushed and confusing story
- Poorly written and poorly executed attempt to establish “emotional depth” by giving the Commander a wife that most players won't care about.
- Lack of mission variety and the fun stealth missions were completely removed
- No side bar like the old games; the entire UI looks bad as a whole
- Too much deviation from the C&C source material meaning it neither look nor feel like a C&C game
- Ridiculously low damage and high HP for every unit that results in...(See next CON)
- VERY slow paced action
- Pathfinding problems
- Severe balance issues
- Very short campaign time
- Small and poorly designed campaign maps
- The game as a whole feels rushed and cheap

[h1]NEUTRAL:[/h1]
+/- The 'Crawler / MCV' unit building system is an interesting idea but it shouldn't have been implemented on an already existing franchise such as C&C because it already has an established (and working) formula.

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
A [b]VERY BAD[/b] sequel which stands as an insult to the fans of a 15 year old franchise. In EA's attempt to “innovate,” they failed to see what made the Command and Conquer games fun for a lot of people.

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
[b]NO,[/b] the game is not worth it. I would [b]not recommend[/b] this game to anyone even on a sale, specially if you're a fan of the old games. You're better off buying the previous titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars[/url] and its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24810/]expansion[/url].

[h1]FINAL NOTES:[/h1]
I would have been kinder in my criticism of this game if it did not have the Command and Conquer name on it. Tiberian Twilight would have sold better and would have been received better by the community if it was merely a spin-off rather than the finale of the franchise.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFXJaYY0TOs]This video[/url] expresses clearly what I feel about this game.

---------------------------------------------------------

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198083227627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1442879920}
review:
As a child... I played starcraft. I got rekked repeatedly. Shrek couldn't have rekked me better. It was awesome.
Then I played Age of Empires. I was maybe 7, and didn't have to use cheats to win finally.
Then Civilization came, and I finally started to understand strategy.
Then I started playing C&C... I got really good, and my computer could just barely run it and life was great.

I noticed this game on here, and thought.. "Hey, why not give a nod to my childhood and play another rts, I even liked the console one a little, so this should be great!"
I tried.
I really really tried. That was just...
I. Have. No. Words.
I opened a skirmish to learn ( Screw tutorials), and just... What have they done. There were no buildings. You literally make engineers, move your giant walking building spider thingy to the objective... And then crap out a ton more people.
This made me sad. This is the worst thing I have ever seen as far as "rts" goes.

CoD has more strategy to it than this. You disgust me EA.

review:
I bought the game before steam had there return policy....  and it was all most worth getting my account locked for 2 weeks jest to get the $10 USD  back.... were the game went wrong ... to many places to start.... read some of the other Rants of you really want to know... no need to post more of the same Complaints.. 

I will say having been and still a CNC fan and supporter and have played then from the CNC, and RA  to this CNC3  and RA2  and the exp packs i was well entertained and very happy with the series as a hole then came this steaming pile of code.... this is a true example of GIGO  (Garbage in garbage out). 

i suffered through this jest to get the story line. of which was also disappointing. 

Dont waste your money on this..

author: {'steamid': '76561198085419594', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1612532078}
review:
光头说我想回家，GDI不批准，于是打打打打打，后来光头一琢磨还是回家好了，于是就回家了。
以上是扯淡，接下来是评测。
这游戏玩法很新颖啊，简直不像是CNC系列的了，资源抢夺抢点，猜我想起了什么？没错，QQ堂的抢包子！
作为一个十多年的CNC死粉，你要说RA3是CNC系列的败笔，那CNC4简直就是把CNC系列踢入地狱的最后一句斯巴达。多了不说了，伤心了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198083631209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1441668901}
review:
Triste conclusion de la saga tibérium.

Le nouveau gameplay est innovant mais il aurait été préférable de le dévoiler avec une autre/nouvelle franchise et
garder le bon vieux style de C&C. 

Campagne pauvre, fade et sans réel challenge.
C'est vraiment dommage d'achever l'histoire de cette manière, on a vraiment l'impression que c'est baclé.

Bof bof, à faire pour savoir comment se termine l'histoire du tibérium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020378838', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1474571082}
review: They ruined it by calling it C&C. Nevertheless the gameplay itself is good, fresh and quite challenging. It's a fast paste RTS with a lot of micromanagement and much more strategy as you might think. The leveling system and the low player base could be better but after all, i recommend it for the sake of the game, not for the name.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984544544', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
Command and Conquer was a classic in the RTS genre. You build a base, expand, create troops, etc...then strategically move to take out your opponents.

If you love Command and Conquer, RTS games, or...games in general, I guess, then stay away from C&C4. It's not even a game, it's a joke. It's so far from the rest of the series, it's mind-boggling, and not only because it plays nothing like them, but because the other games are great and this one is practically unplayable.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106682244', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1531805821}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197989859778', 'num_games_owned': 1840, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1396471367}
review:
Besides what most people say, I like this. 

Ok, maybe it was a really bold step to go with such a new concept in a so well known and well established game series. The story of Kain is finished with this one, with an ending I really can approve. The singleplayer is also playable in coop, which makes in a little bit too easy in my opinion.

The multiplayer is still challenging, because you get to coordinate in larger teams. The game is fast and the two factions are well balanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992349606', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1326009600}
review: Ce jeux n'a aucun intérré, ya plus de base a contruire, l'histoire est encore plus débile qu'avant. passez votre chemin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980292501', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1407614415}
review: I have been a fan of strategy games for a very long time.  Im a casual player and stick to single player vs ai and campaign themes games.  I was hugely impressed by C&C 3 and enjoyed the Red Alert Series and Generals.  Sadly C&C 4 is a terrible addition to the series.  It adds a confusing system of a mobile base with the ability to generate units on the fly but the system itself is flawed and the game play and visuals are poorly executed.  The campaign missions are confusing and later levels are extremely frustrating because the AI knows what units to utilize and what works while you are trying to get units to work.  Then you have vehicle units that have an ability that requires you to manually reload their weapon so instead of unleashing them and leaving them alone to focus on other events you need to babysit them to make them reload and its not like they have a large cash of ammo but like 30 or so rounds tops and can go through that almost instantly.  Do not get this unless you wish to suffer through the incompetent gameplay to finish the Tiberium storyline, because even i couldnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143301307', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1471390147}
review:
Après avoir vue différents point de vue, je décide de revenir sur mon évaluation, qui j'admets était trop agressive :)

Je ne suis pas un grand joueur de STR, je joue plus pour le fun que pour la compétition, je n'ai pas joué aux autres Command and conquer, mais je connais les personnages et 
les factions.

[b] Le jeu:[/b]

C'est un STR, avec une toute nouvelle forme de gameplay qui a déplu à la majorité de la communauté, les Crawlers.
Des machines mobiles servant de QG, elle permet de générer différentes unités, de gérer des améliorations, et des constructions pour les crawlers défensifs.
Donc plus de bâtiment, (sauf pour le crawler défensif).

La gameplay est assez simpliste, chaque unité à une unité de faiblesse qui est indiqué sur sa petite "fiche de présentation" en jeu, avec les hp.

Cependant, malgrès que j'apprécie ce jeu, il à beaucoup de mauvais aspect de mon point de vue pour le gameplay:

-La récupération de tibérium, affreusement DURE, qui encourage les joueurs à build des petites unité à bas coup et rapide pour aller embêter les autres joueurs dans
cette récupération, essentielle pour la late game. Systéme de récupération qui a d'ailleurs aussi changé par rapport aux autres Command and Conquer.

-Systéme de snowball trop présent, un mauvais coup et pour remonter bonne chance.

-Trop peu d'unité total sur le terrain à mon goût, 4 juges même pas tous remplies de Devot.

Les mécaniques ont beaucoup changé par rapport aux autres Command and Conquer, cependant j'apprécie les cinématiques, la bande son, les voix en Français, les personnages.

Peut-être que je suis resté bloqué sur ça, que pour moi le seul fait de voir des personnages que j'apprécie dans un jeu qu'il soit bon ou mauvais me suffit à l'apprécier.

J'ai une bonne expérience sur ce jeu auquel j'ai joué un moment avec un ami, l'univers m'a plu, mais je comprends tout à fait qu'il n'ait pas satisfait les anciens joueurs de 
Command and Conquer, étant moi même très sceptique aux changements.

En éspérant encore et toujours une suite. :)

review: I didn't like the new direction that the developers took with this installment of the command and conquer series. It seemed more like an attempt at making the real time strategy sim more console friendly but instead made the game so simple that PC community frowned at it. If you're into the story then go for it, otherwise you should just stick to the originals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118023782', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1438025277}
review:
I did see that EA made this sequel to the brutal C&C saga and I was sceptic at first, but said why not. After the first 5 minutes of gameplay and visiting the armory (yes, you do have to level up to gain access to units, upgrades, etc) I was even more sceptic. Spent another 5 minutes on the "tutorial" mission and I was utterly surprised. It's magical to see EA ruin yet another game which came, as I said, from a brutal saga in which I enjoyed all the other titles. GJ EA and keep up the good work, not gonna buy any game with your signature on it!

P.S. Windows 8.1 users have fun setting up the game with the graphic settings, took me around 20 minutes for it since it crashed all the time while changing settings (which was less than adequate with options). Oh and I do run GTA V and Witcher 3 on max graphics so my PC isn't an issue for this bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002560288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1460910655}
review: I am a huge C&C fan but don't recommend this game. There is no base building and so it's simply not enjoyable to play. If this conept had been tested on fans during development I would be amazed. Red Alert 3 is still the best out there and it's about 7 years old now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208297412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2253, 'last_played': 1657243564}
review:
I am a big fan of The command and conquer franchise.... usually.
        This is THE WORST (so far) of all the C&C games I have ever played.
        Firstly, the concept of a base was totally DUMPED. instead, you have "crawlers", which create units and can pack up and move around. this seems cool, but only the defense crawler can build defenses (obviously). the crawlers can be upgraded in skirmish and campaign, but you have to LEVEL UP for good units and crawler upgrades. nextly, rather than money, you use Points. (at level 20((the highest level)), you get 60 to use) Say, a nod venom, which is a TINY tier 1 hovering missile plane, takes 3 points. A nod Leviathan(HUGE) takes 20 points(you can have three of those and nothing else). See the problem now? another pain is that it needs internet 24/7, so if i go to ski, i cant play. Lastly, it gets very boring after a while. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. GET C&C GENERALS AND C&C GENERALS ZH (not available on steam. it kills me to say that ((HINT HINT STEAM)))

Thanks for reading,
sigmagames1

author: {'steamid': '76561198134331591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1434271022}
review:
这款游戏如果作为一个单独的游戏我觉得还是过得去的，但是作为cnc的续作来说我感觉简直就是坑爹！那奇葩的AI总在一些莫名其妙的地方卡住，大波单位行走更是容易挤成一团然后互相卡位，移动的流畅度感觉上还不如3代，至少3代很少出现单位间互卡出不去的状况……为什么我感觉这AI还不如好几年前的魔兽3？
 最蛋疼的还是结尾，你确定这不是天朝生产的垃圾电视剧？一片空白的场景配上一个感觉就像是拿泡沫糊起来的传送门我第一感觉就是你特么在逗我？
向来都说育碧服务器烂，我只想说EA这游戏的服务器更烂！至少我黑名单和英雄无敌6从来没碰上1个小时断线3次，登陆半个小时各种上不去的情况
买之前我就知道这游戏风评不好，但我依然买了，并不是因为游戏，我只是来看大光头的！

author: {'steamid': '76561197998156556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1434546726}
review:
Okay so i have been a fan of C&C for about 20 years now and I can safely say this is THE most disapointing title I have ever played.

I'll start with a positive though I did like the asthetic, It wasn't half bad, The nod didn't look quite how I'd expect them to but overall it was okay. However that is the only positive I have about the game and not a very strong one at that, now for the negatives.

Lets start with the most glaringly obvious one which i think everyone feels the same and that's the campaign... This had to be written by some emotionless, imbecilic monkey. It literally starts off going THIS NAMELESS CHARACTER IS YOUR WIFE CARE ABOUT HER!!!! (uhhh okay???) Okay seriously why would I care about this character, I've literally never seen them before but the game just expects you to care about her and really really obnoxiously tries shove it down your throat it's insane because aboviously they're going to use her as a plot device. I think a bloody 5 year old can figure that out.
The campaign is insanely short as well I completed the whole thing in about 2.5 hours, that's it... the whole thing.. and like an hour of it is a tutorial. It ends so suddenly as well I was like wait is that it. I just did like 4 missions after the tutorial crap and then poof, done, over. I can only imagine that they were planning on bringing out a tonne of garbage DLC for this just to unlock more campaign missions.

Now for the Gameplay... 
It's terrible just flat out terrible, it's watered down from other games and lacks any sort of depth or strategy.
This is literally it it, You start off with your main "structure" called a Crawler, now you move your crawler to whatever objective you have which is either one of 3 things: Capture thing, kill thing or Defend thing. (defending thing being the most annoying since you have no control over said thing it will generally just run into things and get itself killed, it's like "Hay you know what would be a fun idea, lets walk face first into that big horde of enemies over there. I'm sure things will be completely fine!"). Now as I was saying here's what the gameplay is: Move Crawler to objective, Deploy Crawler, Throw shit at problem until it goes away, move to next objective. That's it, that's all I did, I didn't have to care about what units I built since all i had to do is build the spider tanks with the big ass tesla coil and throw them at the enemy, I didn't even have to worry about them dying since if you build like 3 or 4 engineers everything you have is pretty much immortal anyway. i didn't even have to worry about my base since there's no base building to worry about and the base came with me anyway so screw defenses. Oh and for tech it's literally hay see that red crystal over there? yeah pic that up like 1 or 2 of them and you can INSTANTLY unlock every single bit of tech you want.

So that's it that's C&C 4 in all it's terribleness. The only way I could possibly recommend this game is to play it just to see how bad it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117660212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1434525942}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032785779', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1514459591}
review:
ich habe zwar nur bischen über 2 stunden gespielt aber mir reicht es! Ich habe die schnauze voll von diesen "game".

Jeder der C&C liebt sollte sich diesen teil nicht kaufen weil es einfach kein C&C ist.

Einheiten limit - seit wann das? Das geht gar nicht !!!!!
Taktik - brauchst du keine, man muss nur darauf achten das immer einheiten gebaut werden.
Grafik - war schon viel besser (achtung, Augenkrebsgefahr :-/ ).
Musik - die musik ist einfach eine endlosschleife die gefühlt 10 sekunden sich zu wiederholen scheint.
Sounds - war schon viel besser
Interface - viele Schaltflächen die man erst benutzen darf wenn man weiter ist.
Die Einheiten - Quantität statt Qualität so sieht ein futuristischer Krieg sicher nicht aus (nicht vergessen 50 Einheiten limit, 5 Panzer und schluss). Meiner meinung viel zu viele verschiedene Typen die alle irgendwie nix drauf haben. Übergroße mega Kanonen haben sie alle die minmal schaden machen (soll das witzig sein?)
Baubare Gebäude - gibt es eigentlich keine.
Gameplay - Einheiten bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen und das beste sie kosten nicht mal was weil sowas wie einen Sammler braucht man nicht weil es gar nix zu sammeln gibt!

Ne mal ganz im ernst.
Wenn ich gewusst hätte wie sch***** (sry) der Teil von C&C ist und ich nicht so voreilig auf das Angebot reingefallen wäre, dann hätte ich das game nie gekauft.

Command and Conquer R.I.P.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068153097', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1434396822}
review: I would not insist on buying this game, with all due respect to EA. This game is nothing alike to C&C3 and is gravely disappointing. The entire layout of the game itself is different and suffers without the classic base-defense. I was hoping that the story would lift off after C&C3: Kane's Wrath, but it seemed to stray from the storyline itself. C&C3 is my top favorite C&C. I am happy that I bought this game for a real cheap ~4$ during this year's Summer sale. I would be furious if I wasted 20$ on this game. I would hope EA would develop a C&C5, but the "fans" insist that they don't even try and let the series die with dignity due to the horrid C&C4. If they are to make a new C&C, it would be like the classic and traditional C&C.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082807523', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1434483802}
review:
Игра так себе. Но я предостерегаю вас:
Вы купили игру, зарегались в мухосранском ориджине, активировали ключ и теперь играйте. И если вдруг вам стукнет в голову удалить игру - не делайте этого!!! После очередной установки он попросит у вас заного ключ. Но он уже активирован т.к. прошлый раз вы активировали и 2-й раз нельзя (вот это поворот). А пропустить это нельзя. Если у вас много времени и нервов - можите попробывать написать в саппрот, да и то могут послать.

А еще можно поступить проще - не покупать игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971572891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1587927219}
review: The game do not match what the C&C games sould be for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088228398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1434220884}
review:
Ich war nie ein ausgemachter Fan der C&C-Reihe, aber in C&C 1 oder RA mal ein paar Tanks spammen und Gegner niederballern hat schon immer Spaß gemacht. Die Story war auch ganz witzig, das Technoflair stimmig, und alles in allem ein wirklich hübsches Spiel.

Tja, jetzt war Teil 4 im Sale, und ich dachte mir, schau Dir mal an, wie C&C heute so in modern aussieht. Aber gleich vorweg - was auch immer EA aus C&C gemacht hat, es ist nicht mehr C&C...

Es gibt ein Einheitenlimit, und man kann keine Basis/Gebäude bauen - man platziert einfach sein MBF irgendwo auf einer vordefinierten Fläche, gibt ihm eine von drei taktischen Ausrichtungen (offensiv/defensiv/Unterstützung), und spamt dann nur noch Einheiten. Eine richtig schöne Masse wie bei den alten Teilen kommt dank des strengen Einheitenlimits aber trotzdem nicht zusammen, und so wird einem das Leben künstlich schwer gemacht. Taktikverständnis wird im Prinzip nicht gebraucht, es ist mehr wie ein modernes Clickergame.

Ich hatte gelesen, dass die Kampagne sehr kurz sein soll (es sind wohl 2x7 Missionen), und dachte noch, das halte ich durch. Habe jetzt bei Mission 5 aufgehört und werde stattdessen eine Wand streichen gehen. Der Farbe beim Trocknen zuzusehen macht nämlich viel mehr Spaß als C&C 4...

Bleibt nur noch anzufügen: Schade um den Klassiker. EA ist ein echter Sensenmann der Spielkultur...

author: {'steamid': '76561198161993912', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1434805507}
review:
……虽然看了这么多差评但还是凭着对C&C的信仰入了……结果一开始就卡在登陆界面怎么都连不上服务器，想玩个战役而已都不行，ae你特么逗我，游戏内容是好是坏我还没资格评价，但这么一个渣服务器还要每次都联网验证我真特么没法忍。
………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………

……玩过大概20H,明白为什么叫它WTF了，怒删都难以发泄我现在的心情。.蛋疼的人口和等级设定,本来就不想玩久只想速通战役还要在遭遇战上花几个小时刷等级。ai上NOD支援只会出眼镜蛇，对上GDI支援就算是凶残打简单也是被吊打。还有就是万年不变的网络链接问题，连不上服务器意味着游戏也玩不了，好歹你设一个离线模式不行么。最后我想吐槽剧情，朋友说4代剧情渣得要死，个人感觉剧情主线还可以，但就是糟糕的叙事硬-生-生把一个本来至少可称优秀的剧情给毁-掉-了。其他要吐槽的地方我都记不清了。只想说一句——把我的C&C还给我！
      最后客观说一句，这游戏概念和质量其实还是不错的，错就错在他的名字是C&C。要是你喜欢魔兽什么的微操，或者说今年那个灰蛊的小规模战斗，那么这游戏还是适合你。但如果你是因为它是C&C而来，恐怕你要失望了，不建议入，否则会颠覆你的世界观的。当然你说信仰喜+1什么的我也阻止不了你，就像我当时瞎了眼没有管下面一大波红色评价并阻止自己剁手一样。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970127395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4138, 'last_played': 1467518772}
review:
I actually quite enjoyed playing this despite the bad publicity it has. Yes, EA do what they typically do and use a name to sell a game that's completely different from what is expected of it. It probably should have been an offshoot instead of a sequel. If you can ignore that then it's not that bad of a game and has no serious technical problems.

The game is basically just dumbed down and casualised RTS that's good for playing for 30 minutes. All the more complex aspects such as base and resource management are thrown away leaving you with the job of looking after 1 master unit, the Crawler. You collect Tiberium crystals to receive upgrade points and when the Crawler is destroyed it respawns at a drop off point. The Defense type can construct buildings but only buildings such as the Obelisk and Nuke/Ion Cannon which require the Crawler to be alive to operate. Support buildings can also be captured but cannot be destroyed.

I completed the campaign and played some skirmishes. The skirmish mode is a little shallow and some extra customization would have made it much better such as increasing the unit limit for games with more players. I'm going to give it a thumbs up for that at least. If you want or expect a traditional C&C experience then don't get it and stick to C&C 3 or the older games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974193304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1433393991}
review:
Do not buy this game.

Many people gave this game a bad review because the many changes in the game formula. Is fair to say that this is not a sequel to Command & Conquer, It is much more like a action strategy spin-off. 

That is not the reason why this game is bad, but here are some reasons why you should not buy it:

- Permanent online connection require to play. In the middle of the campaign EA servers went down and now i simply can't play until they decide to go back up. Now i am here, angry, writing a review.

- Requires you to login and input your password every time you start the game.

- Unskippable cutscenes

- Lack of mission variety, is most of the time build troops and walk around the map destroying everything in empty skirmishers style maps. Is really hard to believe that this game was released in the same year that Starcraft 2 came out.

- The new mechanics are really average, there is not much do to. They cut out resource collection, all you do is choose the appropriate MCV to the situation and walk with your troops.

- Units are ultra resilient. It may take minutes of firing to kill an enemy armada. Combat is not fun.

Edit: You also lost the mission progress when the game lose connection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002259554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1648905013}
review:
I played and loved Command & Conquer since the very first hour on this ol'good 486 PC. It was the early 90's.
A beloved time period. The time of Dune 2 where it was impossible to select groups, only a single unit at a time,

Westwood Studios gave birth to a new kind of gameplay called Real Time Strategy with a game whose name became legendary: Command & Conquer. The war in real time with boobs and rock music. God that was good. That... WAS... Q_Q

Came EA who made this shitty robbery called C&C4. Watched without comparison it may be an interesting game... BUT I can't watch it without comparison because of its name: COMMAND & CONQUER.

EA killed Command & Conquer and give the corpse to be raped by anyone who is clumsy enough to hope the final chapter the C&C franchise deserved. Sorry for being badly disposed like this but I was clumsy enough to believe EA would give (sell) me the C&C4 of my dreams. Instead I had a stinky cadaver wearing a "I'm with stupid -->" T-shirt.

SCREW YOU EA.
RIP Westwood Studios.

PS Excuse my probable mistakes in English which isn't my first language.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065767010', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1585950414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011089269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1373927405}
review:
This. This is what you get when you have a Command and Conquer game...but remove everything that [b]IS[/b] a Command and Conquer game. Absolute total tosh.

No base building, no resource gathering, no huge army, you [b]HAVE[/b] to have an internet connection at all times even if you're only playing single player, small variety of units that you need to level up to gain access to in the first place...and well, you get the idea.

I tried to get into the game, I really did, but an hour is all I could manage before I made up my mind.

I've played C&C ever since RA95 and loved every other C&C game upto Kanes Wrath. RA3 wasn't [i]too[/i] bad, but it isn't really great either, Uprising again, wasn't [i]too[/i] bad, but not great.

This is just the final nail in the coffin for this franchise...or I guess in EA's terms, this game was the final check on their list of "[b]Excellent Game Franchise's to ABSOLUTELY destroy[/b]"

NotEvenWorthARating/10, as it's just that bad. Kane is [i]very[/i] disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972644377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1314601200}
review:
I would rather play with a dog turd than play with this turd of a game.

A fantastic franchise ruined by EA's terrible decision making. Avoid this game at all costs, it honestly isn't worth the money and craps all over the C&C franchise (not just the tiberian universe). 

Terrible story, terrible graphics, terrible controls, no proper base building, no real strategy, cartoon style graphics, no  atmosphere, poor level design... just... overwhelmingly terrible.

Listen to the reviews, it is not worth it. Youtube the custscene videos if you want to know they how butchered the story and endings.

edit: played via origin hence no play time on steam. CD key activated on both systems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002586115', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1426377022}
review: I really liked other games in the C&C series, but this one took half the game out of the equation. There is no economy, no macro game. It's all microed combat. No building, no resources. I really don't like the tech system. Campaign play is a little grindy and recycled, but if the game stayed the same but included bases and resource gathering and an econ long-game, that would be fine, but it doesn't, and I'd give it a 3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089411567', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1544523646}
review: Ну что могу сказать об игре..... Вообщем 3 часть была офигенной и я ожида точно такое же и в 4. То что я увидел было печально. Нет больше тибериума который нужно добывать, что является местной валютой. И это самое обидное и ужастное во всех нормальных стратешках это нужно делать тут такого нет. И что бы убить человека 5 танков мало очень долго все умирают. Но всё же я фанат игры и она довольно понравилась, графон, музыка, сюжет подкачал. Зато выполнен красиво. Ну вообщем 7^3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198029563340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1613898123}
review:
En el 2012, me acuerdo cuando en el blog de una cosplayer de España había debatído sobre el final de Mass Effect 3, el cual le parecía injusto que el final decepcionara tanto. Yo le había respondido "Si eso es lo único que te ha decepcionado de EA, es porque no has visto el final de Command & Conquer 4. Eso SI que es una verdadera decepcion". Si despues de eso, no ha jugado a esto, espero haberle hecho de alguna forma un favor invirtiendo su tiempo mejor en otra cosa mas interesante, como mirar un muro, por ejemplo xD.

Lo que voy a contar lo digo desde el punto de vista de fan de la saga. Aquella franquicia que me hizo fan de PC por excelencia (mucho antes de Starcraft, Max Payne, KotOR, Medal of Honor, etc) fue, sin duda, Command & Conquer (C&C), mas o menos la 1era instancia para MS-DOS allá por el 1995. Asi que me voy a tomar un tiempo en explicar el drama que aqueja a semejante monstruo que es esto.

Durante la franquicia, su antigua desarrolladora (Westwood Studios, el cual a fines de 1999 fue absorvida por EA) había generado 2 lineas temporales: la 1era basada en la guerra fria entre las potencias occidentales Vs. La Unión Sovietica (URSS) y la 2da en la que se basaba originariamente C&C:  El universo de Tiberium.

 Para hacerlo breve: en la decada del 90 en Europa del Este cae un meteorito con un mineral verde llamado Tiberium el cual empieza a esparcirse por todo el continente, y que consume los recursos y minerales de la Tierra, no obstante, su letalidad con todo ente biótico con que entre en contacto tambien es consumido por el cristal, lo que genera una amenaza grave para la sociedad mundial. Es entonces cuando surge del anonimato una sociedad secreta que adoraba al cristal, conocido como la Hermandad de Nod, liderada por un sujeto megalómano conocido como Kane (el cual se lo considera el mesias, había predicado la nueva era de tiberium para la humanidad, etc. No muere realmente en casi ningun juego). la ONU, para contrarestar a esta organización de que asimilen para ellos solos el cristal, genera una división militar internacional contra el terrorismo conocido como la GDI o Global Defense Initiative. Posterior a esto, entre estas facciónes se generan 3 guerras mundiales (que vendrían a hacer cada C&C de Tiberium) en el que la cantidad de muertos se cuentan por millones, mientras el tiberium casi consume todo el planeta, destruyendo ecosistemas y extinguiendo al ser humano a la par de los conflictos bélicos.

Y es aquí en el que entra la descripcion de este juego. en el 2062, casi 15 años despues de Tiberium Wars. El mundo esta casi totalmente devastado por tiberium, y la extinción de la especie humana es casi inminente... pero un día Kane, se levanta de su siesta, escuchando Joan Manuel Serrat al canto de "Hoy puede ser un gran día", va  a hacer una visita a los directivos de la GDI y les plantea un plan para salvar al mundo del cristal verde y que sean todos hippies, y así salvar la humanidad....

... tiene sentido? por supuesto que no. Pero bueno, sacando el sarcasmo, esto es lo que pasó realmente en este juego. Aparentemente un lider como Kane, el cual declaró la guerra a GDI, y fue participe de genocidios masivos, como hacer desaparecer casi toda europa con una bomba de tiberio liquido, de repente quiere aliarse contra sus peores enemigos con los cuales hizo guerras durante 80 años, para reparar el mundo (¿?) cuando él mismo quería que el planeta sea consumida por él....
Si no tiene sentido, está el guionista del juego, un tal Sam Bass, que se merece una patada en el trasero por esto. Supuestamente ESTE iba a ser el ULTIMO juego del universo de Tiberium... y así lo dejó.

 Que desastre... y otros se quejaban del final de Mass Effect 3...

Ok, con respecto al juego, que tenga el titulo de C&C no implica que se sienta como uno. Este juego es el intento de EA de hacer novedad en la franquicia, generando un MOBA, pero destruye lo que hizo clásico al C&C, poniendo limite de población, y sacando la construcción de bases, y NO HAY TIBERIUM (hay algun cristalito por allí en los mapas para mejorar poderes, pero no hay lo mas importante del juego!) por ende, no hay recolección de recursos. La idea es hacer un edificio móvil (Crawler) que permite la construcción de unidades de forma inmediata. Las conquistas de los mapas, se tratan de capturar diversos puntos estrategicos hasta que se alcance el limite de puntos, en multiplayer. Aunque llevado a la práctica, el juego es divertido y los mapas estan bien realizados a la par de que los combates no se detienen por nada, aquí no hay casi referencia a nada de command & conquer que lo hiciera famoso. Además para aquellos que se hayan comprado el juego, 1ero tienen que jugar la campaña para luego entrar al multiplayer, porque tiene un sistema de progresión de arsenal que se comparte tanto en single como en multi, por ende muchos se aprobechaban de esto y destrozaban a noobs por este tema. A pesar de esto, reconozco que el gameplay es bastante entretenido y divertido, pero se siente muy parecido a un Dawn of War 2, versión 2.1 en lugar de que se sienta como un C&C

Para aquel que sea casual, este juego le va a resultar interesante, porque su gameplay es frenético y las unidades son bien variadas, pero para el fan hardcore, sabiendo que este sería el final de 15 años de C&C, esto es un disparo a quemarropa al corazón (EA no piensa volver a este universo, solo utiliza un juego de Facebook horrendo en su lugar), así de simple ... al menos que seas capaz de dejar eso de lado y disfrutar el juego simplemente por lo que es y pensar de que  la historia de Kane pudo haber concluido mejor de lo que tristemente fue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993357850', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1669755919}
review:
I am 28. I experienced most Westwood titles (c&c 1 / ra 1 ...) and this is by far, the worst in the serie but not only that, it manages to be THE biggest disappointment in the RTS history:
Gradually when went like => C&C 3/ Kanes Wrath (great) => Red Alert 3 (average) => RA3: Uprising (horrible) => C&C 4 (TERRIBLE).
In short: No more base building, Joe Kucan (Kane) doesn't act that well anymore and is an hero (... after being the anti-hero for 15 years...), no defensive strategies (you need to capture points and thus need to go all-on offensive else you lose)...
So many failures in such a great franchise.
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070240863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2750, 'last_played': 1437175088}
review:
Its a fine game. Its not as fun as the old command and conquers but it gets more right then wrong...kind of. it has good graphics,fun multiplayer, decent combat but suffers from some problems like how every unit is a tank, the awful rock paper system, the story is....just the worse and there are just most units that are there just to fill a requirement rather than bring fun new tatics. The game also has the best units in the game locked behind a level wall buuuttt the leveling was made me play for as long as i did and the voice acting is nice tooo. 

Oh the game also has drm which means it can't be a classic like its predecessor's.
Its ok but very underrated.

5/10 average

author: {'steamid': '76561198027442827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1445334429}
review:
EA continue to kill the most famous RTS franchise ever made.  Main annoyance with this game is the camera is zoomed in too close on units - so even at high resolution you have a very limited view of the action.  The game's innovations (selecting one of three tech types before starting the match; mobile base building; RPG experience system) are cumbersome and bring very little to the table.

Waste of money - consider RUSE / Sins of a Solar Empire:  Rebellion instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080448169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1818, 'last_played': 1696676416}
review:
I've played my time now, so here are my thoughts:

positive:
-interesting storyline
-new gameplay
-easy to learn
-balanced to some extend

negative
-just 11 Level one has to get as Commander
-short story
-depending on how you play, multiplayer games might end onesided

So if you enjoy the multiplayer mode of RTS games, you should buy this one. If you are a fan of storylines, 10€ are too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041012754', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1327305600}
review:
This is a vast departure from Command and Conquer. There is no base building, uninspired and somewhat lackluster units, and a weird leveling system (you unlock units as you gain levels so someone with level 10 units could join your campaign and breeze you through it hilariously). The multiplayer is not much better. 

The story is forgettable and the acting is mediocre. This game can be avoided altogether.

review:
别问姐为什么要买 我买来就是为了给差评的

author: {'steamid': '76561198040743599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1343026800}
review:
If you are contemplating buying this because of your history with C&C. Don't waste your time. A monkey could shit better game design. Do yourself a favor and keep your eyes off this one. I bought it on a whim thinking C&C? All the rest were good, why not this one? Immediately put-off by the no base/resource management system. Pick your class? When....when do you choose your class at all throughout this or Red Alert's game series'. What made them think this was a great idea? Innovation? CREATE A DIFFERENT SERIES! Everyone was expecting C&C, instead what we got was the pointy end of the sword that was shoved through the Tiberian series' back. Covered in straight up shit. 

(1)"This whole [i]franchise[/i] is in danger of being covered in a huge cloud of.....sshhhhhit!" 
(2)"Huge cloud of shit?! Wooowww! I think I smell it, come on! Let's go! Come on [i]Red Alert,Tiberian Sun[/i]!!............Hey everybody there's a shit cloud comin'! Run for your lives!"

*Original quotes taken from the movie "Kingpin", [i]1996[/i]. Actors (1) Woody Harrelson and (2) Randy Quaid.

review: First time playing this. Not a fan. It's like the took C&C and tried to make a DOW2 version... but did so very poorly and without the WOW aspects that made DOW2 tolerable. I play C&C normally for base building and some good ol RTS battles... I didn't get that here. For this style RTS (capturing points), I'd stick with DOW2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990058386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
In an effort to reinvent itself, Tiberian Twilight discards everything enjoyable about the Command and Conquer series and is left with gameplay mechanics that feel both broken and incomplete.

It's no suprise the franchise has been diminished down to a pathetic web browser knockoff.  

The old glory of C&C is gone.  This is a horrible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038078997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1570668520}
review:
I would recommend this game for a few reasons only. First off the gameplay is NOTHING like any other C&C game, there is no base building, no resource collection, and no big strategy.  This game does have a good story line to it, I’ll give them that, and that's why I recommend this game.  Most people love games not for the gameplay or graphics, but for the story line, and this game has a good story line.  This game may be nothing like any other C&C game, and that’s another reason why I would recommend it, it's new, not just a knockoff of the other games, it's different, and some may hate that, I don't like it but I respect that they tried something new.

Now if you’re new to Command and Conquer let me say I would not recommend this game to you, if you want to get into this franchise then try out C&C Generals, or if you looking for something on Steam, then try Command and Conquer 3 Tiberium Wars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084772080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1399251497}
review: Terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013288876', 'num_games_owned': 1730, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1477075463}
review:
This is the ruination of a legacy the likes of which is only matched by the Highlander: the Source, the prequel Star Wars films and Spiderman: One More Day. They destroyed everything that made the games great, turned it into some kind of DotA rip-off, which is ironic in itself and produced a story twist that makes literally NO FUCKING SENSE.

I keep coming back to this as an example of how completely a franchise can be ruined. Don't buy this game, don't even download it illegally. If you have to know what happens, look it up on the wiki and make sure you're not drinking anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970197230', 'num_games_owned': 1458, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1485005013}
review:
also zuerst ja es ist kein c&c im eigentlichen sinn... nur finde ich die reviews nicht gerechtfertigt, klar 16h auf schwer ist jetzt nicht der hammer an zeit fürn singleplayer modus... 

zur Story, einfallslos und relativ sinnlos.. nämlich nod gegen nod, gdi gegen gdi und nod gegen gdi... ohne aliens

allerdings gameplay jetzt rein objektiv betrachtet (unabhängig von c&c) finde es einfach mal bißchen was neues und wenn man sich daran weng gewöhnt hat ists auch recht funny zu spielen.. auf lanpartys fehlt mir persönlich leider ein offline modus oder dedicated... aber gut mit bissl internet gehts auch...

Positives: 
-leicht zu erlernendes gameplay
-einfach gehaltenes leveling was anfängern den einstieg erlichtert
-zwischendrin nen netter zeitvertreib
Negatives:
-kein vergleich mit C&C (egal welcher teil)
-keine basis muss erbaut werden
-dumme ki

You guys should buy this only when on discounted price, or don't bother purchase it.

review: It plays a little different than some of the other games in this series, but for me it was still an enjoyable experience.  I should mention I only played the single player portion. I don't like multiplayer because there are too many folks that try to ruin the experience for others as a joke to themselves, so as a general rule I stay away from multiplayer games.  I still had lots of fun with the single player and would recommend to anyone that likes RTS games.  You don't have to play the other games in the series, but you will learn more about the characters if you dd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004502020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1416600167}
review:
Took me almost half an hour to start this up because the required registration page wouldn´t allow me to create an account. (Support also requires you to be logged in already, I bet the guys at EA find that hilareous)

The point where I could not go on because it was so ultimately boring was about an hour into the game.
Until then I really suffered through the bad interface and the annoyingly low zoom out possibility.

There are other RTS franchises out there already that are a lot closer to what a good C&C used to be. 
Have a look for them instead, your money is not only invested much better, they also actually deserve the support. 

I had this in my library for quite some time since it was part of a bundle. 
This was a good reminder for me why I stay clear from EA titles as much as I can.

review: started playing command and conquer since it came out in '95. this one is HORRIBLE. i was so jazzed up to see what would come next in the story after tiberium wars and kane's wrath and i was left with the utmost feeling of dissatisfaction. videos are cheezy and look poorly filmed. previous cnc games' vids felt almost like a movie. no base building? no harvesting? ea took a giant shit on this franchise and totally used the name of command and conquer to sell this turd under false pretenses. this is the worst thing to come out of ea; even worse than origin (which is saying something). i don't normally write reviews for games but this one was so crappy that it compelled me to tell people to stay away. STAY AWAY. erase this game from the saga just like indiana jones 4. 0/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971037288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1412020126}
review:
Они говорят нам: Мы очень старались. Игра отличная. Игрокам надо просто не подходить предвзято к новому геймплею.

Ок. Не подхожу. Игра - шлак. Игра в жанре, на секундочку, стратегии, в которой стратегия редуцирована до таскания краулера за войсками по полю боя, а тактика - к определению по принципу "камень-ножницы-бумага" нужного рода войск для текущей ситуации и накликиванию их необходимого количества в панели заказов.
Отстройка базы? Добыча ресурсов? Планирование развития? О чём вы - всего этого больше нет.

Что осталось на том же уровне - это сюжет и видеовставки. Первый логично завершает историю (хотя, сколько раз уже казалось, что она завершена), а вторые - традиционно отыгрывают это событие с выдающимся пафосом и мастерством актёра театра самодеятельности химкомбината. Разумеется, это нисколько ни умаляет игру, поскольку является её, своего рода, визитной карточкой. Умаляет её то, что чтобы получить "тот самый" сюжет на "тех самых" роликах приходится продираться через уже помянутый всуе чудовищный геймплей.

Что в итоге? В итоге ничего. Игры нет. Остался какой-то обрубок расчитанный на некую абстрактную "новую аудиторию", которая должна, внезапно, появиться в старом сеттинге. Что до меня - если бы была возможность сдать игру назад и получить назад свои деньги - сделал бы это незадумываясь. В конце концов, если бы я хотел поиграть спинным мозгом, запустил бы CoD, Crysis или FarCry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024147455', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1707166565}
review:
ABSOLUT GRAUENVOLL
Nachdem in den Vorgängern so viele Möglichkeiten gegeben wurden ein packendes und spannendes Finale aufzubauen, macht dieses Machwerk im Grunde alles zu Nichte für was Command & Conquer steht. Basisbau und das Sammeln von Tiberium flogen raus, stattdessen Einheiten auskotzen und nerviges Mikromanagement. Eigentlich ist das Spiel unwürdig den Schriftzug C&C im Namen zu haben, denn für die Kampagne muss man sich wirklich schämen. Kane hat so viel Stil und Klasse verloren. Immerhin macht der Multiplayer einigermaßen Spaß, obwohl es schon fast Richtung MOBA geht. Schade.

review: The worst in the series. I am currently requesting a refund, as I truly wish I had not paid money for this.

review:
This game is filled with endless action....but not the good kind, more like the "WTF, NO F***ING WAY!" kind that you may find whilst being no scoped in COD. A good addition for anyone trying to complete all the C&C but nothing more. After many hours of play i have decided that not only was this game rushed and poorly constructed but that C&C3 is 10 times better in almost every front.

My advice: Just buy C&C3, it's cheaper and better!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987097488', 'num_games_owned': 1902, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1351839600}
review:
Sooooo............. C&C 4: Tiberian Twilight..........
I've have been a C&C fan since I was 4, aka from 1998. The first game was perhaps the first game I have ever got and was the series that got me into both gaming and real time strategy games. So as you can see, when I heard abotu C&C 4, I was prepared to enbark on a good bye party for my beloved franchise. However, I had to scrap it when a leaked beta information on the gameplay changes the game was gonna make. Therefore I avoided the game like the plague. Once the game was finally released, did I feel guilty of having to abandon the party?
Apparently not cause not only did the reviews show little discouragement but 98% of all the C&C fans like me cryout in anger for the series. Obviously this game recommendation from me was Hell no (and I'll repeat it again at the end for those who are too lazy to read this and skips to the end. 
So why is the game bad? Well the first problem is the gameplay. The gameplay in terms of C&C gameplay felt like it was design by satan. Rather than traditional gameplay where you would collect resources and build both a base and an army to conquer your enemies, the game went Moba like based game with a unusual population limit (which drew me away from the game) and a requirement of playing from other people. Another thing that the game is known to have been hated on is the story. Now I haven't played the campaign but from what I heard, it's a cluster f*(k. 
So is there one thing I like about the game? well......... I do actually enjoy the music which is actually pretty good.
In conclusion, if it wasn't for C&C being in the game, it could have been ok, but the C&C is a perminate damage to the game for I have to say I do not recommend the game

For people who want to skip to the conclusion on whether to own the game or not, the answer is HELL NO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034813199', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Garbage. This franchise has, sadly, bit the dust. This is not a base-building game of the golden RTS days. It's some sort of mobile-strike force strategy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990574799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1410078283}
review:
Did one of the devs get drunk and say fuck I've got a great idea, no bases, no resources just units. Fuck yes let’s make that a game about spamming the build unit button GENIUS!!

If you are trying to decide whether to buy this game or stab yourself in the hand with fork I recommend the fork, its far less painful and you won’t have to listen to the commanders annoying whiny wife.

I highly recommend playing one of the older C&C games to get your fix leave this game where it belongs at the bottom of a very large refuse pile!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005308784', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1385392135}
review:
My review is based on my personal experiences and with the background of having played and enjoyed Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars right before purchasing this game. It is to be said that this game and its dynamics, even the approach to it all, differ fundementally from the previous installment. The game is rather based on having mobile bases, not only encouraging of establishing only temporary bases, but even forcing you to hastly settle down only to for the most urgent actions and to move on in a giant caravan of units and your mobile command/construction building in order to survive. In the sense that [spoilers!] the planet is a Tiberian wasteland invaded by an Alien species in this installment, it gives off this nomadic post-apocalyptic feeling, which might be quite matching but hurt the gameplay experience in my opinion. Everything feels less permanent, rather like an action-packed campaign mission where your goal is not to build up a base and start offensives from there, but to utilize the little you have to outsmart your (in this case, also) mobile enemy.
I personally love building up a base and having the responsibility of using terrains to defend its chokepoints and entrances. I was surprised and rather disappointed after playing the third installment just before this one. The graphics are less realistic and although this might have been the intention of the developers to return to the 'semi-comic'-feel, it felt sloppy and like being let down after CnC 3: Tiberium Wars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096311867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1454783399}
review:
Make sure you come in to this with some background reaserch under your belt, This is nothing like the command and conquer franchise you have played before. admitidlly they have tried something new but it hasnt worked. to much has been taken away from the core gameplay of a real time stratagy to make it worth your time.
Always online DRM
No base building
No rersource managment
Low unit cap
No tactical advantage to any units
its boring repetitive and wont make you thing the way this genre of game is supposed to. if I could give it back I would
here is my opinion - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7eKPHBPnBXY

author: {'steamid': '76561198039922099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1383556634}
review:
Ссанина. Печальный конец истории о тибериуме. Совершенно не хватило сил освоить идиотскую новую систему управления. Да, теперь вам не датут строить базу, а вынудят управлять гигантской ходячей постройкой - Краулером. Все то, за что я любил С&C: строительство базы и её развитие, гибкое управление, интересный дизайн юнитов... всё здесь похоронено. Теперь вам придётся гонять этот краулер по всей карте вместе с лимитированным количеством юнитов-близнецов.

НИРИКАМИНДУЮ КАТЕГОРИЧЕСКИ. 299 рублей, в своё время заплаченных за неё, жалко.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993108076', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1405554633}
review: Very disappointing. They took out all the things I love about RTSs and replaced it with a mobile command unit and a points system. Battles are fairly boring, and I couldn't stomach my way to the ending of a story I've been following my entire life. (Thank God for Youtube)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027485122', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1430984103}
review: I'm a fan of RTS games, I've played every C&C game already, so I just have to try that one... and well... My first impression was bad cause I thought 'what the hell ? how do I suppose to build an base ? why I have unit limits etc.. ' however after some more time when I was playing with my friend, I've changed my mind. Graphics is really good and many units to choose makes game really strategic one. To make summary I'll type my general rating as an ( 6/10 ), and even if it's the worst title from C&C series, it's still worth to try.
