author: {'steamid': '76561198097953163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1409348514}
review:
It is not often that I am disappointed and depressed by a video game but unfortunately C&C4 has got to be one of the most awful games I have ever had the misfortune to have played.  Before I start the criticism of the game, I feel that it would be fair to mention the one redeeming feature because there is only one and that is Joe Kucan reprising his role as Kane, about the only thing satisfying for a long time fan of the series such as myself.  Now on to the downsides.

1. The complete lack of base building and resource gathering.  How you can even label this game as an RTS without these core elements is beyond me, instead of the staples of the RTS genre, units cost a certain amount of "Command Points" and that's it.  No tiberium, nothing to be gathered or collected or used tactically, just a limit placed on you at the start of the game and boom click a button, create units up to the limit and that's it, that's the extent of resources in the game.  And as for base building, much the same applies, you have a power limit so you place down a certain number of defensive turrets up to the limit and that's really all there is to it - on both fronts a complete lack of anything in-depth, evidence of a second rate game aimed at a minor market being shoe-horned into something much bigger than it actually is intended to be.

2. The units/maps/graphics.  The units provided at the start of the game are weak and ineffectual so in order to obtain more units you level up and then unlock them which sounds like a fairly simple concept, that is until you realise that exp. for leveling up is difficult to come by.  The lack of exp. becomes apparent after still not being awarded any after completion of the third mission in the story meaning that in order to progress your tech, hours of play time is required to unlock even just mostly mid-range units.  The weakness of initial units isn't alleviated by the fact that you can make large numbers as the Command Point limit applies so you are restricted to small squads of units, not the massive armies you expect from an RTS game.  To go with the theme of a small number of units, the maps which battles are conducted on are best summed up as tiny, cramped arenas with very little room for manouvere meaning it's goodbye to any tactical thinking and hello to comabt which feels scripted and unintelligent.  As if the unit/map situation was not already bad enough, this steaming mass of disappointment is served up in a graphical style more akin to a comic book setting, gone is the sleek, futuristic, powerful look of C&C3, it is instead replaced by  out of place, chunky, Megablocks style units, which completly destroys any sort of serious mood the game intends to create.  The graphical style of C&C4's units is so far removed from C&C3's that they're not even in the same universe, nevermind the same page.

3. The story.  It's fairly obvious that the story is terrible from pretty much the word go as one of the first scenes has you, as commander, greeted by your wife.  Yep, that's right, your wife because that's just what an RTS story needs, a bullshit love interest forced into the game.  From then on the story goes rapidly downhill, not aided by the dire acting of all those involved (with the exception of Joe Kucan) and then ends with the equivalent of "And they all rode off into the sunset and lived happily ever after."  Seriously? After having fought now at this time 4 Tiberium Wars, having battled across the globe and faced all manner of foes whilst still wondering about the mystery of Nod and Kane and what the ultimate goal could be, it ends with "Kane and all of Nod travel through the alien tower and leave GDI behind on a tiberium-free Earth having left them peacefully".  I have to wonder what it is with EA and their amazing ability to consistently screw up epic storylines and disappoint faithful fans of a beloved genre because that ending is just utter horseshit and reeks of a rushed writing crew being forced to pull something out of their asses.

So to conclude, C&C4 fails to deliver on all fronts: from dreadful mechanics and weak units, to poor acting and a storyline that could arugably have been concieved by a 5 year old, C&C4 smacks of poor quality, despiration and coporate greed.  A truly disappointing end to a great series, something that should not have come to pass.  I cannot urge you strongly enough, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

Oh and one last thing... EA please if you would kindly go fuck yourselves bloody with a rusty sword that would be greatly appreiciated, you cunts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992482412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1701031765}
review:
Un jeu qui n'est pas digne de son prédécesseur. L'histoire est incompréhensible, le gameplay est novateur mais démoli par un système de grade inutile pour débloquer les unités en multijoueur. 

Niveau graphisme, c'est pas une claque mais il est correcte. Honnètement, ce jeu part d'une bonne initiative d'inovation mais on sent très vite une répétitivité qui s'installe en multijoueur et un scénario beaucoup trop pauvre en mission. 

J'ai fini la campagne du Nod en coop en moins de 4h et sans comprendre le début et la fin. 

Si vous voulez débuter cette série, passer votre chemin, le 3 est bien meilleur ! Tout est à jeté sur celui-ci.

Buy Tiberium Wars, it's infinitely better than this. -10/10 , would not recommend to my worst enemy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979407755', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1407009574}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist eine Frechheit! Wenn ich gewusst hätte wie schlecht dieses Spiel ist, hätte ich es mir nicht gekauft. Lustigerweise sieht man während des Sales nur positve Wertungen...EA ist ein echter Dreckskonzern geworden der seine Franchises melkt ohne Ende. Wenn Ihr ein RTS haben wollt aus der C&C Serie mit GDI und NOD, dann kauft euch C&C 3.

Sowohl Menüführung als auch Ingamesteuerung sind sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig, eher unübersichtlich(ich hab zuviele RTS gespielt als das ich mit Steuerungen nicht zurecht käme)
Das Erfahrungssystem ist möchtegern innovativ und unzureichend erklärt, wegen fehlender Top-Down-Struktur(besser bekannt als Talentbäume, weil gibt keine)
Zudem sieht die Grafik wie von nem Konsolenport aus, alá PS2(Ultra-Hoch eingestellte Grafik ist akzeptabel, wenn wir 2006 gehabt hätten)
Es fühlt sich wie huschhusch-aufn-Markt-damit an.
Kauft es nicht, nichtmal im Sale, nichtmal geschenkt, supportet EA einfach nicht mehr solange bis die wieder anfangen Games zu machen die Spass machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992320026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1407009320}
review:
Also wer C&C kennt vom 1. Teil an, ein SUPER Strategiespiel mit guter Story... zumindest bis zu diesem Teil. Selbst C&C Renegade was total den Vorgängern entsprechend als FPS released wurde war noch 1000 mal besser als dieser Teil der C&C Serie. Wer hier auf einen Classiker der C&C Reihe, wie man es kennt, hofft, irrt sich hier leider in jeder hinsicht. Vergleicht man dies zu den "alten" Teilen (Ja ich weiß allles war früher besser etc. etc. pp.) ist dies der größte Griff ins Klo den ich je von C&C erlebt habe.

Nur als Info für euch ich fand C&C bis zum heutigen Tage eines der (für meinen Geschmack) BESTEN RTS Games die es gab.
Seit heute werde ich wahrscheinlich jeden weiteren C&C Teil meiden.

Klare NICHT-Kauf Empfehlung. Auch nicht im Sale/SuperSale und als Geschenk wäre es von euren Freunden eher ein Gack weil diese zu viel Geld haben um euch ein bisschen zu necken.

Liebe Grüße

Ein enttäuschter G4rd1u5

author: {'steamid': '76561198049520696', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1406733323}
review: Купив эту игру я надеялся увидеть продолжение игр серии C&C, но к ОЧЕНЬ большому сожалению это не так. Единственное что мне тут понравилось- это возможность прокачиваться и более-менее кампания. Режим сражения убил меня своей унылостью захватывать вышки и набирать очки надоедает очень быстро. Возможно я просто не любитель таких игр, но мне правда больше нравится что-то типа старых игр серии C&C. Графика также особо не блещет. Кампания тоже особо не затягивает, но как говорится 'Видели и похуже'. Я бы никому не рекомендовал бы покупать и играть в эту игру, если вы конечно не любитель таких игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129342747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1395186288}
review: Disliked. Big fan of the Command and Conquer series but this one was meh. 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034811845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
I do not like writing negative reviews but sometimes it has to be done I guess.
If you know your C&C games, one of the first things that will come to mind is usually building a base. Unfortunately this game does not really have it. In my eyes, it just doesn't quite stand up to any other C&C game. Though I didn't put too many hours into it so maybe I didn't give it a good enough chance?

Put simply, this would have been a much better game if the name "Command and Conquer" was not part of its title. Since it is not like the other games in its series, it isn't what people expect to get when they pay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141249862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1406825993}
review: Ох, как же я ошибся. Много прошло времени с момента релиза игры и негатив, почерпнутый в 2010 году из обзорных статей, практически развеялся. И решил я взять игру на летней распродаже в стим, чтобы узнать как завершилась история Кейна. Короче, это самая ужасная игра, в которую я когда либо играл. Она невероятно, чудовищно скучна: однообразные юниты, отсутствие тактики, получасовое добление одного здания противника, ужасная графика, картонно-кислотный дизайн юнитов и их кривая анимация. Даже ролики - фикушку серии - умудрились испоганить и лысина харизматичного Джо Кукана не спасает ситуацию. Не повторяйте моей ошибки - не покупайте и не играйте в ЭТО, а сюжет можно узнать на youtub.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064156757', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 35215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6391, 'last_played': 1555831919}
review:
Behold disciples of Nod, for the end is soon upon us. Electronic Arts’ award-winning and best-selling Tiberium saga is coming to a powerful conclusion with Command & Conquer 4, which will introduce a multitude of innovations to the classic fast and fluid Command & Conquer gameplay, while retaining the core compulsions that fans have come to love over the series’ history.

It is the year 2062 and humanity is at the brink of extinction. Tiberium, the mysterious, alien crystalline structure that has infested Earth for decades and served as the primary reason for years of relentless conflict between the Global Defense Initiative (GDI) and the Brotherhood of Nod, is close to rendering the planet uninhabitable. Mankind is on the verge of extinction when Kane, Nod’s prophetic leader, emerges from seclusion to deliver GDI the message that he has developed a system that could control Tiberium and harness its power. But he cannot build this "Tiberium Control Network" without GDI’s cooperation. Thus, the two opposing factions – GDI and Nod – inevitably find themselves in desperation for the same cause: to stop Tiberium from extinguishing mankind.

After 15 years, the network is nearly complete, Tiberium is under strict control and our revitalized, newly terraformed planet is on the cusp of a new age of prosperity and progress. It is then that the world’s citizens begin to seriously ponder why Kane chose to help, and what will he want in return. These questions and more lead to the dramatic final act of the Tiberium saga.

With a multitude of innovative new features to the fast and fluid C&C gameplay, Command & Conquer 4 offers players an entirely new way to play C&C. An all-in-one mobile base, persistent player progression across all game modes that is constantly updated in a real-time online profile, a 3-class system for each of the two factions, co-operative play, and a 5v5 objective-based multiplayer mode that promotes teamwork and social interaction, make Command & Conquer 4 unlike any other C&C experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961358449', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1404617350}
review:
I have so many mixed emotions about this game.

One of my biggest beefs with this game is that it's just plain short.  There are only 7 GDI missions,  7 NOD missions, and 3 common missions.  I finished it all in 14 hours.  Not much room in there for story.  The story they did have, and the cutscenes, seem very low budget and thrown together.  No Hollywood actors this time around.  The final cutscene in each campaign is literally the actors standing in front of a white sheet with a drawn picture.  If they had doubled the number of missions, I would be recommending this game.  It seems like they're trying to bring a lot of focus onto multiplayer, but I'm only interested in the single player aspect.

One thing that took a little while to get used to is that they changed the gameplay style.  Previous C&C games have had the formula of building/defending/expanding a base, managing your economy and power, and trying to push out as many units as you can.  In this game, you have a fixed number of points that can be redeemed for units, another set of points for structures, and third set for skill upgrades and expanding your tech tree.  There are no power plants, harvesters, etc.  And if a unit is killed or a structure is lost, you get your points refunded, and can build it again.  A key strategy is to continually move your MCV forward, towards the goal.  This makes most of the maps very linear.  Once you can get past the dramatic difference in play style, the game actually gets enjoyable.  Though some of the time, it just feels like you're filling up your build queue so you can spam the enemy.

With the new all-in-one MCV style, they added something that I thought was not well executed.  Instead of just one kind of MCV, they now have three:  offensive, defensive, and support.  Offensive is mostly for making units.  Defensive is for setting up structures like cannons and bunkers.  Support was totally useless to me, as it's for making repairs and setting up airstrikes.  The reason why this wasn't well executed is that you could only have one MCV at a time.  So you can't be defending a structure and attacking the enemy's MCV at the same time.

review: another terrible rendition of what was an awesome game. i dont think there has been good one in a long time. retalition was defo the best one for me. Generals was not bad either. holding command posts, and unit caps that are far to law cripple this game. just a couple of missions in where you have to ensure the safety of a civ convoy, although one or two slip through until completion of the level, the entire thing feels like a losing battle until you "win" all because of an overwhelming amount of enemy units against your measly 10 units. i miss the days of having massive armies of tanks and men. unit caps has ruined these games for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140965539', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1404464670}
review: WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING. If you have actually played ANY Command & Conquer game in the past, this is a WARNING to you. This game is completely different from any other Command & Conquer game. If you played any other C&C and you enjoyed the way it flowed, loved the way it played, and loved the concept, you most likely will not like this game at all. This game 100% resembles an old mobile game that was only on phones that had a SLIDING KEYBOARD. Think about that. THIS GAME IS BASICALLY JUST A PORT FROM A MOBILE GAME FROM SLIDING KEYBOARD PHONES. And how do i know that this is true? Because i had one of those phones and i bought the mobile game. even for $4.99, the mobile game wasn't worth it. i only slightly enjoyed it because i literally had NOTHING BETTER TO DO, and you can believe me when i say that i am a die hard C&C fan and lover. Ive played every single C&C game to date, and for once, this is a C&C game i regretted playing and wasting $20 on. So i will repeat. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME UNLESS YOU ARE 200% OPEN MINDED TO SHITTY IDEAS. THIS GAME IS COMPLETE AND UTTER CRAP. DO NOT BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091684090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1389919893}
review:
This game is just a grind.  You have to work to permanently unlock things that you would generally unlock and upgrade every game in previous installments of the game, so if you play online you're guarenteed to get steamrolled by someone who has played longer.

The game offers different spawn ships that only allow certain units to be built with each and are supposed to follow certain playstyles but ultimately just end up limiting the game and the amount of fun it could have offered.

I love the C&C series, but this game has had some horrible decisions go into it.  If you want an RTS, I'd reccomend picking up either C&C Tiberium Wars 3: Kane's Wrath, or C&C Red Alert 3, as both are top notch games from the same series, and infinitely better than this waste of code.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035593596', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1370565586}
review: Let's go kick some scrin butt! What? They're not in this one?! Why in the world would you introduce a new race and then the next game just steal it away?! Okay, Pros and Cons. Pros: Nothing. Cons: Everything. Believe me when I say this game is complete.. er.. poop. It completely takes away the drain based economy that everyone loves and replaced it with unit population and too rare tiberium crystals for upgrades. You cannot construct buildings unless you choose the defender MCV. That's another thing! Different MCVs, and multiple lives for them! Well, I hope some people agree with me, bye.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988526707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1403872687}
review:
download it, played it for 10 minutes and deleted it, wasted my 6GB of harddrive space. WTF..... i want to play command and conquer for what it is, if you want to launch a new type of game system and all that, launch it under a new game title franchise.  where is BASE BUILDING, WHERE IS THE UNLIMITED UNIT BUILD , BUILD EVERY UNIT OF YOUR CLASS GDI/NOD   i thought this C&C going to be like the ones before. but its totally different, if i want to play a different system of no base building , and tactical crap. i will get something else to play, like plants and zombies. 

an analogy : what if one day, COUNTERSTRIKE LAUNCH a new counterstrike sequel, and guess what its a turn-based strategy RPG game instead of FPS. i will be pissed at VaLve. (just for example) for this i am pissed of with EA games. 

IF I CAN GET A REFUND I WILL. but i cant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042397439', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1393811177}
review:
Rinnovare un gioco porta quasi sempre dei benefici, ma anche molti rischi.
Farlo in una saga così importante e nel suo capitolo conclusivo, inoltre, non è stata la scelta vincente.
Togliere completamente la gestione della costruzione della base ed eliminare la raccolta delle risorse in favore di un maggior dinamismo, poteva essere un buon punto di partenza, ma visto il risultato troppo approssimativo, questo quarto capitolo farà storcere il naso anche ai fan meno incalliti.
In Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight l'attenzione del giocatore non è più rivolta verso la fortificazione di un luogo sicuro da cui far partire i propri attacchi, ma viene diretta verso la gestione di poche unità e di una base mobile andando così a cambiare radicalmente il modo di giocare rispetto al passato.
Il fatto di non doversi più preoccupare di perdere la propria base principale ha portato pesanti modifiche anche nel sistema del gioco online lasciando così spazio a modalità più vicine alla freneticità degli sparatutto piuttosto che agli strategici, portando così il giocatore a lanciarsi negli scontri con il proprio arsenale spianato, anziché a ragionare e attendere il momento giusto per evitare di vanificare i preziosi momenti passati ad accumulare risorse e soldati come avveniva in passato.
Per fortuna non tutto è andato perduto; i video di intermezzo mantengono il carisma che da sempre caratterizza la saga del tiberium e la storia vi stupirà con diversi colpi di scena.
Interessante anche il fatto di poter giocare la campagna in modalità cooperativa nonostante questa sia di scarsa durata. Discorso a sé per il multiplayer che a causa dei livelli di esperienza e di alcune combinazioni di unità aeree dei GDI inarrestabili, si rivela un’esperienza online troppo sbilanciata.
In conclusione questo era un prodotto con le potenzialità per divenire un must, se solo si fosse limitato a essere Command & Conquer e non un titolo che ne mantiene solo il nome sulla copertina ma che ne modifica profondamente lo stile di gioco, non ottenendo i risultati desiderati

author: {'steamid': '76561197993735217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1453526821}
review:
EA's Failed experiment.

I don't like it, the older ones are better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005133168', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1450584527}
review:
I can only recommend this if your a true fan of the sries and want to see the last of the Tiberium Saga.  While its not a bad game in its own right it defies a lot of typical conventions that C&C has had since its inception in 1995.    

However if we forget that this is a C&C game and judge it on its own merits.  I'll say this, first its a fast paced game and unlike  previous C&C games it requires you to think about using your units right as each unit now has a strength/weakness mechanic more so in this title.

Graphics wise its visual fideltiy is pretty impressive for an RTS game and even though the ammount of units you can have is limited the battles do in fact feel big, which is a plus.  

As this is a C&C game you can expect well acted real time cutscenes and these are the most impressive I'vse seen so far.

Now for problems.  

One of the major issues is that players can level up outside multiplayer and then take that rank/level into multiplayer, meaning there's no sense of progression and someonne can just anhilate you in multiplayer because you've not unlocked all the units/upgrades.

Bottom line this can be a fun title if you can forget it has anything to do with Command and Conquer, but it also appeals to true fans.  Generic RTS fans may want to avoid this title.  Which is the only reason I can recommend this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009750557', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1632853360}
review:
如果我说命令与征服3是命令与征服系列复活的一点预兆的话，那么命令与征服4就是EA把命令与征服系列推上绞架恨不得立刻将其绞死，之后再将尸体拉出来让人们凭吊（亦或是唾骂）——没错，命令与征服4就是这么一“坨”被糟蹋的差不多的尸体。

命令与征服4首先最不能容忍的就是将延续下来的，以资源转化为单位的传统RTS即时战略改成了以指挥点数为资源的即时战术游戏，——命令与征服作为RTS鼻祖之一最后落得必须更改为即时战术游戏，作为游戏标志的泰伯伦矿居然变成了升级用道具，难怪公布时玩家会大喊“还我大片大片可以收割的泰伯伦矿！”一款没有泰伯伦的命令与征服，这简直就是对命令与征服系列的亵渎。

至于游戏的在线模式完全就是在和同期的星海争霸2的模仿，仿效SC2一样采用与网络平台合体，强制联机的方式，将游戏的单机内容完全捆绑在在线模式之上，可是万万没想到的是，命令与征服4没有提供离线单机体验模式，很多人想打剧情，就只能连接上连线质量并不怎么好的EA服务器。并且还得注册一个EA账号（即后来origin账户），

另一方面，可能是对命令与征服3系列忽视命令与征服2的风格的一点“补偿”，本作矫枉过正的打造了一个满屏太空服士兵和机甲的战斗场面，但是这些机甲与命令与征服2的风格完全不搭界，三种机甲主基地的外观被斥之为“春卷”和“乌龟盖”，可以说明显就是画虎不成反类犬的一个体现。

至于剧情，在将Westwood硕果仅存的几个成员干掉之后，新的编剧Samuel Bass大展自己胡编乱造的能力，将原有“泰伯伦黄昏”的剧本完全无视，秉承着迫不及待将剧本写死的态度写出了一个漏洞百出的大结局，并且十分幼稚的秉承”只要把GDI写坏，把NOD洗白就好”的简单思维，把原本GDI虽代表正义但是内部腐化，NOD表面邪恶却拥有宗教一般的反派魅力的两种风格给彻底的黑白分明化，并且将其安插在一个犹如肥皂剧一般的剧本中，最终肯恩更是莫名其妙的离开地球了。

至此可以看出，这个剧本，就是为了判命令与征服本传系列死刑而写的，他自始至终就传达着一个意思：C&C——DIE！

在EA LA饱受摧残之后，命令与征服4成为了LA改组前的遗作，刚刚度过红色警报3的磨合期，整个命令与征服系列的标签从Westwood到EA LA，第二代CNC的风格崛起这一系列蒸蒸日上的迹象之后，EA LA又因为命令与征服4步了Westwood的后尘，于是我们看到了一个不伦不类的命令与征服4，以及其代表的真正的“泰伯伦黄昏”——属于命令与征服的黄昏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007508554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1404547028}
review:
Shocking that this can even be called a Command & Conquer game. I heard about how bad it was, but decided to buy it since it was on sale for $5. It is atrocious. All the base building aspects are gone, instead you are given a "crawler" which you can set up and produce certain units and structures/abilities depending on if you chose offense, defense or support. I only suggest buying this if you hated previous C&C games since this is the complete opposite of past games. I plan on finishing the campaign, on easy to get it done with faster, and to never play it again.

EDIT: You may enjoy the game if you liked World in Conflict's multiplayer aspect. The whole game plays like it, where you are forced to pick a strategy and stick with it. However, it is more limited because in World in Conflict you could still make most units, however in this game you are forced to only make what your strategy allows. There is no overlap at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020895205', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 86400}
review: A disgrace to the C&C series. Do not buy it! Even if they offer if for a free weekend, the price is too high for its worth. What made this game so crappy? The gameplay, the story, and the idea of taking away the concept of base building and resource gathering. Every fan knows the story of GDI vs NOD. GDI's purpose is to contain the Tiberium and stop NOD from using it as a tool. NOD wants the tiberium to claim it as the next step in human evolution while informing the world that GDI are a bunch of fascists that care for the rich and abandon the sick and poor. BUT C&C4 throws that all away when Kane uses the Tacitus, the item that the 2 factions fought so hard to obtain and unlock the secrets of it, to ally with GDI and destroy the Tiberium that infested the earth. I bought it because i love C&C from the start of playing red alert. After Westwood was gone, it all went down the drain. C&C3 was good, but aliens?! blah! I would have loved to see CABAL come back, but EA made up for it with Kane's Wrath. But this...this is like a giant middle finger to all the C&C fans from EA.

review: The first... IDK.. Dozen or so games were great.  Red Alert was the first game I ever played all the way through as a kid.  Once upon a time C&C was selling a first decade collection, those are all great games.  But the franchise lost something in the last... well since RA2, whenever that was, that was the first C&C I got bored with before the end.  And this one... Trying to turn it into some sort of mmo hybrid?  Why does every game have to me open to be played with the world now, needing help from strangers to make progress?  I suppose this game could be fun to play as a LAN party, but I don't see any other way to make this game remotely fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041497655', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1489370727}
review:
My first C&C game was tiberian sun. With that I followed the C&C series closely and have played every single one ever made including the ones that were on console. This...this is the worst C&C to ever be created in the history of mankind. all the years following the story, all the years of playing, all the years that I put into this game and waiting to finally see the ending chapter to the Tiberium wars, And this is what we get? EA has taken the game and twisted into something so horrible that words are incapable of ever describing the disust I feel.

This isn't a C&C game. This is utter garbage and other words so foul that they don't even exist. There are no words that exist that can describe how utterly putrid this "thing" they call a game is. Do not buy this. Under any circumstances, do not buy this. Do not even pirate this game. It is a waste of your life and you will thank me later.

This game is so terrible it almost isnt worth writing the review for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996778425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1488540982}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000653214', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2450, 'last_played': 1653813890}
review:
I tried really hard to like this game, as it's the final C&C game that it looks like we're getting in a long time - could even be the last the way EA is heading with their BS. This game shows a fantastic idea, a fantastic concept, something that could have worked out great - IF IT DIDN'T HAVE THE LABEL AS A FULL ON SEQUEL TO THE TIBERIUM UNIVERSE C&C GAMES. As a spinoff, this game would have been mediocre, but as the official sequel and ending to the C&C storyline, this game is abysmal in every way possible.

Not a single thing feels C&C about this game - theres a tiny population cap, there's no base building, there's no resource collection, maps are small, the campaign is abysmal with a terrible storyline and cutscenes that don't just look bad - they are legitimately stuff someone likely recorded with their iphone camera and slapped into the game! Just watch any sections that involve the "public" speaking rather than paid actors. The only saving grace in the storyline is Joe Kucan, who as always takes the role of Kane and makes an extremely badass villain until a terrible ending that's the same regardless of which faction you go with - AN ENDING THAT'S THE SAME REGARDLESS OF WHICH FACTION YOU GO WITH. Let that sink in.

The progression system is terrible - yes, there's a progression system. This game revolves around collecting tiberium crystals INDIVIDUALLY and using them to upgrade your MCV to higher tiers to unlock better units and such. However, when you start, you are level 1 and have access to absolutely NOTHING. Only after you level up several times will you unlock the 2nd tier of technology which at first is completely worthless without a single thing used for it. Everything has to be unlocked through progression and this BLATANTLY makes anyone who's a higher level than you stronger than you with no workarounds based on how good of a player you are or anything, PERIOD. For example, you have to pick a class - offensive, defensive, or support. If you go defensive, at the beginning of the progression scale you only have access to 3 infantry units. No vehicles of any sort, period. While these infantry units CAN be used to counter other infantry, vehicles, or aircraft, they're all infantry and can be MUCH MORE EASILY COUNTERED by a diverse enemy army.

This is a game that again, has a fantastic concept that was soiled by something that clearly had the goal of being made with the least amount of funding possible, the least motivation possible, and the smallest amount of time necessary to produce it - probably so EA wouldn't have to pay people to work on this game any longer than they would have to before it was BARELY functional as a game and could be pushed out the door, which is exactly what they did.

And what sucks is, if everyone is maximum level on progression, the multiplayer can actually potentially be fun. It feels like the game was designed for that, but it was just unfinished, so to pad the length of the game and make people play it longer, they slapped progression in to make you grind to be level 20 (the cap).

Do not buy this game. If you want a good C&C game from recent times, go with Red Alert 3. Just don't expect any multiplayer options since this is the ONLY C&C GAME to not run on Gamespy and the gamespy servers are going to tank here in a month.

review: 내 게임 인생 통틀어 최고의 뒤통수를 날린 게임.. 난 본디 스타크래프트로 RTS에 입문했다. 그러다가 컴퍼니 오브 히어로즈와 C&C3에서의 분대단위의 유닛 구성을 보고 스타와는 다른  매력을 느꼈는데, 이번 게임에서 나는 최고급유닛에서 일반 유닛으로 추락한 존트루퍼에 실망했고 분대단위로 구성되어 정말 장군처럼 지휘하는 느낌을 받았던 그 충족감을 전혀 느낄 수가 없었다. 만약 나 처럼 분대단위 유닛을 떠올리고 이 게임을 바라보는 사람들이 있다면 진심으로 말리고 싶다. 세일이라지만 이 게임을 산 돈이 매우 아깝고 다운로드하고 설치에 걸린 시간도 매우 아깝다.

review: As a fan of the original Tiberian Sun C&C game I expected this remake to be at least as good as the original.  It is TERRIBLE!!!!  The fun in C&C games, because they seem not to have understood it,  is to be able to build strong defenses and large bases, outposts and a solid economy ?!? With the machanics of this version, it is absolutly IMPOSSIBLE to accomplish, at all!!!  This thing with the crystals to gain access to slight advantages absolutly sucks.  You need to play many hours before gaining access to 50% of the units available using only boring to play and weak mech_infantry units.  From my point of view, they would rather keep the unit layouts and apply the game mechanics of the provious version...  At least it would be playable.  What a rubbish!!!  DO NOT BUY THAT, unless 1-2$, very frustrating game!!!

review:
Words cannot describe how much this game is terrible.

I could forgive the All-in-One base thing they were doing with the Crawlers because the Concept was cool, but THIS is not how to do it. It would've worked with World in Conflict if they made a Futuristic Sequel...and if it had better controls.
I wish that it was C&C 3 that ended the Tiberium Saga, That was how it was intended at first...then EA's Unquenchable Greed fucked it in the ass without lube.

But, its EA, What do you expect. I am surprised that this game did not come with a DLC that allows you to have better units, units that would be essential to win the game and units that you'd HAVE to have in order to win the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063050456', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1590221439}
review:
"глазки-РАЗВИДЕТЬ" вот с таким заклинанием я сидел после этого "чуда". Конечно предполагалось что игра может быть спасительным кругом своей новой системой боя...но это был лишь фарс. Игру загубили и изничтожили как только смогли, хуже не куда. 
Графика:
Помните ту полу/реалистичную графику в Command & Conquer 3, эфекты лучей Скриннов или солдат NOD? так вот сдесь ее не ждите,тут непобоюсь этого слова УБОГИЙ ГРАФОН, да-да именно убогий, такое ощущение что я играю во вторую часть,даже на максималках это не торт-еще четче видны косяки моделей.
Игровая механика:
Хотите отстраивать базу создавать крутю армию или использовать другие тактические штучки? вам не сюда идите дальше.
В начале боя выбираем один из трех типов МСЦ который выыполняет роль бараков/завода и всех сданий сразу, создаем ограниченное число юнитов и илем в лобовую ибо враги тупы как пробки.
Сюжет:
Думали на этом "вкусняшки" остались? а вот фиг! Сюжет проходишь с трудом,но не из-за сложности, а из-за убогости всего чего только можно; Кейна превратили в откровенног г*вно,он потерял весь свой шарм и харизму, даже фразы бравых фанатиков звучат как слова умственно отсталых...мир попросту невозможно изучать из-за отвратительности всего и вся на кажлм шагу

Вообщем серию загубили- игру заканчиваешь с большим трудом пересиливая себя ее не удалять ради просмотра финальных роликов. Разве то игра в которой нужно себя пересилить и закончить? Увы и ах-конец франщизе-эта часть поставила жирную точку если не крест.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988373809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1395179345}
review: play it in coop or don't play it at all

author: {'steamid': '76561198056112846', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1423311755}
review:
Ich empfehle euch das spiel NICHT zu kaufen! 

Die Vorgänger von C&C waren um einiges besser. EA scheint wohl nur noch schnell Geld verdienen zu wollen. Nach einer Anmeldung in Origin (wobei das sehr unverständlich für mich ist da das Spiel in Steam ausreichend geschützt ist) bin ich dann ins Game gekommen.

So misserable war noch kein anderes C&C. Mit nur einer Spielmodi (Herrschaft) wird es schnell langweilig. 

Wer Wert auf große Schlachten und langes Spielvergnügen setzt sollte dieses Game meiden!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988485371', 'num_games_owned': 4379, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 6783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1590097192}
review:
Eins vorweg: Ich spiele C&C seit 1995, habe jeden Teil mehrfach durchgespielt, auch auf den höchsten Schwierigkeitsstufen und diverse Online und Lan Matches hinter mir. Kenne mich dementsprechend mit der Materie aus.

Kurzfassung

Ja, man kann das Spiel, wenn man es wie ich im Angebot kauft durchweg spielen, sollte es jedoch NICHT zu C&C zählen, dann macht das Spiel durchaus Spaß, auf wenn man egal mit welchem Crawler, einer mobilen Einheit die ähnlich der mobilen Waffenfabrik von Tiberian Sun ist, man eigentlich nur vor die gegnerische Basis fährt und den Gegner mit Einheiten totwirft.

Langfassung

Kampagne: Neben dem, schnellen und recht lustigen Multiplayer ist die Kampagne ja das eigentliche Augenmerk, leider wurde hier viel verändert. Der Spielcharakter ist mal wieder namenlos, hat diesmal eine Ehefrau in den Cutscenes die ebenfalls nicht mehr die Klasse anderer Teile erreichen. Die Charaktere sind, zumindest für mich unbekannt, flach, überspitzt kitschig und mit für mich unbekannten Schauspielern besetzt. Storyline mehr als flach, aber ich will hier nicht spoilern.

Grafik

Ungefähr auf höhe von Tiberium Wars, somit immer noch die Generäle Engine, die trotzdem irgendwie "eckig" wirkt in sachen Einheitenbewegung und Crawlerplatzierung, ähnlich Alarmstufe Rot 3.

Sound

Durchaus okay, bekannte Sprecher, EVA von der gleichen Person gesprochen wie in Tiberium Wars. Leider fehlt knackiges Geschützfeuer.

In eigener Sache

Leider wurde mal wieder einiges geändert, abgesehen vom Crawlersystem. C&C 4 sollte eigentlich ein Onlinespiel nur für den Asiatischen Raum sein und somit Starcraft ebenbürtig werden. Die Kampagne kam erst im nachhinein, das erklärt viele Logiklücken. Die typischen C&C Waffen wurden durch realistische wie z.B. P90 in Cutscenes geändert, die Hintergründe sind nur blinkende Computerwände, ähnlich Carters Versuchslabor bei Stargate SG1. Die GDI Uniformen wurden ebenfalls gegen realistische Uniformen getauscht. Zwar haben beide Seiten wieder SciFi Einheiten wie man es in der Zukunft auch erwartet, doch komsicherweise haben alle Leute scheinbar einen totalblackout, da scheinbar keiner mehr weiß das Schallwaffen Tiberiumkristalle zerstören. Die Liste geht noch um einige Punkte weiter, aber ich denke man versteht was ich sagen will.

Fazit

Nettes Skirmish/Multiplayerspiel, mit Online und EA Registrierungszwang, aber 0 Storyline. Ironischerweise sind die Entwickler teilweise jünger als ich selbst, vielleicht liegt bei der u20 Generation die akzeptanz für Action statt Story höher.

7,5 von 10 Punkten

author: {'steamid': '76561198000511807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1346223600}
review:
Terrible. Absolutely the worst C&C game ever made, without a doubt, I don't know how EA could make C&C 3 so incredibly amazing and then do a couplete U-turn and make this. This may well be the worst game I have ever had the misfortune to play. I paid under £5 for this and it was still too much. I feel like EA should be paying us to play this.
The "always-online" that EA has a big hard-on for lately is a nightmare.
The only reason I bought this was to concluce the CnC tiberium storyline and even that was terrible. Did you know there's no more tiberium in this game? Literally, it's pretty much all gone. No base building, no harvesting resources. You can train units without any cost but only up to a very, very limited unit cap. I'm talking REAL limited. Like you can only train enough units to have a decent attack force or a decent defense force. Not both. I expect that kind of limit on a console RTs but not PC.

DO
NOT
BUY

review:
타이베리안 트와일라잇.. 일명 춫4.

'자원채취 -> 기지건설 -> 생산 -> 전투' 로 진행되는 전통적인 C&C방식과 달리 컴오히나 워해머, Z 같은 땅따먹기 스타일의 RTS로 장르변경을 시도한게 특징.

이런 이질적인 작품이 외전도 아니고 4라는 정식 넘버링을 달고 나왔다는건 맘에 안들지만, 전작들 상관없이 자체 게임성만 놓고보면 그럭저럭 할만한 수준.

드디어 케인의 승천을 볼 수 있다.

review:
The only reason to buy a copy of this utter travesty of a game is to burn it. If you're a fan of the Command and Conquer series, if you remember them fondly from your youth, if you've played any other RTS, no matter how bad, all this will do is make you die a little inside. 

One copy needs to be saved to act as a warning from history. An example of things that must never be repeated. I'm sure EA will keep one somewhere. Burn the rest and delete anything digital. Please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119224489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1406958589}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968380578', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1523584960}
review: For anybody who loved the older Command and Conquer games: STAY AWAY! Command and Conquer 4 strays so far from the original Command and Conquer formula that it is virtually unrecognizable as a Command and Conquer game. Gone is the base building and resource gathering, replaced with a "mobile crawler" and a rather stifling hard "population cap" as well as a need to gather experience to unlock other units. What Electronic Arts was thinking when they put this one together is beyond me, and while it may have been a good game on its own, it's not a Command and Conquer game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093943854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1393149465}
review: waist of twenty bucks and you cant even play offline the end game is the same the trailer is pretty much the best part of the game, i literally hate this game. ive been a cqc fan all my life but this game just ruined it for me. in short, its just plain aweful

author: {'steamid': '76561197961314453', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1392942171}
review:
Don't listen to the people who say this game sucks. C&C4 is a legitimate step forward in RTS mechanics, distilling the fun of what you used to call "base building" in the game's offense/defense/support crawlers. 

I picked Defense and played through the campaign. Guess what, it's anything but "Defense." If you could call crawling up in the enemy lines, plopping down defense towers and bunkers next to their shit, and letting your therefore heavily shielded infantry tear everyone up, "defense." 

The game shows that there is pretty much no need for RTS games to go through the traditional stages of build-up and then push. In this game, you just push. Or get pushed. All day. Can't take it, well, there's Starcraft for you people who like having to memorize tons of bullshit before actually playing the game.

See, there's a reason why people enjoy games like DOTA-like games. It's because they took the fun parts out of the RTS and put them in a game by itself. Give C&C4 some credit for doing the same thing but for base building, army composition, and micro. In time you guys are going to look at games like C&C4 as the first (though mis-advertised) baby steps toward actual computerized strategy games where it's easy to pick up and play but the strategy is really deep like chess and Go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997559839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1379651083}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026867022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1392522450}
review:
This game killed all that C&C have built up over the years. Thay took all that C&C stand for and trow it away.
No base building, no resource gathering and Scrin whas gone even if i whas not that huge fan of them geting in Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars. But taking out the main core of the game and re-build the game to have walkers making units for you and tiberium nodes and crystals that give you upgrade points. The lvl system for unlocking units and upgrades is not good for a singelplayer or multiplayer.

I do not recommend that anyone buy this game even if thay are a C&C hardcore fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096709322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1389802843}
review: Долгое время я играл в предшественников стратегии серии Command & Conquer , и до этой части мне доставили все её предыдущие серии , но это жалкое продолжение былых частей игры данной саги . Здесь практически нет улучшений в графике , я бы даже сказал , что она возможно хуже , так как её просто поменяли на другую ... Я ожидал гораздо большего от этой игры и пожалел о своей покупке , если бы я не знал о её предыдущих частях и не играл бы в неё вообще , то наверное и не стал бы преобретать . Эта часть меня очень разочаровала ...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991185027', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1375052691}
review: This game is everything that is wrong with the C&C series. Ever since the closing of Westwood Studios the entire franchise has been plummeting to it's death brought about by a starvation for innovative game play that remains true to the original series. Tiberian Twilight proves that there are no new good ideas left and C&C needs to be put to bed or have the reigns handed off to someone more responsible. This game ended up being one of the worst RTSs I have ever played and the person who bought it for me felt the need to apologize for the rotten pile of progamming that sits in a place of dishonor amongst my Steam games. Do not buy this and do not play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010485559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1391646542}
review: I have been a lifelong CnC fan, but this game really screwed up the formula rather than innovate it. The lack of base building or resource gathering means that the game is just a mad rush to build as may units as possible, throw them at the enemy, and repeat. Only one of the classes can build defenses. the leveling up system means that you are grossly underpowered in multiplayer matches until you grind up to the top. This complelety destroys the balance as you could only have access to tanks while your opponent is using Mastadons. Also, the story and the acting is awful. It's college level bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068851682', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1391248289}
review:
Tiberian Twilight does not deserve the Command & Conquer title. It's a chugging slow C&C wannabe with kindergarten storyline, irritating and clumsy interface, and a huge learning curve even if you've played the series from day 1. Also dont expect to be able to play AT ALL if for some reason you're unable to connect to the internet. 

While C&C3 kept me busy for hundreds of hours, this one made me feel complelled to leave mid mission, before my first hour was up. I'll need to be seriously drunk or delirious to try this one again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100854670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1550176068}
review: Всю серию похоронили... Я помню всю офигенность гейплея в C&C3 который поражал колличеством возможностей и разнообразием тактик, но в 4 части все просто... убрали! Как можно было из нормальной стратегии в реальном времени, сделать что-- между МОВА и стратегией, причем с полным отходом от прошлого сюжета (от него остались разве что Кейн, да и то он тут убог, и названия некоторой техники, да и то малой части, с полным несоответствием оригиналу)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007046669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1390695466}
review: If your looking for the same awesome RTS experience as the previous Command and Conquer Tiberian titles, then do not get this game. Playing this game literally depressed me. I am such a huge fan of the C&C Tiberian franchise and this game is terrible. There is hardly any strategy, no base building, and you don't have to obtain resources anymore!! I have no clue what EA was thinking when they made this game it is so beyond god awful I just don't know how else to describe it. The camping is boring, i find that I pretty much have to force myself to play it. In the other installments of C&C I couldn't leave my computer because it was just so addicting. This game is a disappointment and a waste of money to even the most hard core fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008683936', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1582726340}
review: Худшая игра из всей серии Command and Conquer - нулевой сюжет, однообразные бои в сети за Царя Горы, никакой возможности привычного строительства базы и никакого сбора Тиберия. Ещё умудрились и Кейна загнобить, что тот даже привычных игроку эмоций в игре не проявляет. Обещали откровения всей Тибериевой Саги, но ничего не вышло. Никаких своих секретов Кейн не раскрыл и удрал фиг знает куда. Но хоть музыка фееричная. Надеемся на исправление своих ошибок в возможном Command & Conquer 5.

review: Вот все обсирают, а я похвалю. Продолжение истории неплохое в целом, а эта фича с бесконечными ресурсами и прокачкой делает совершенно новую игру! Это новая игра. Не продолжение! История старая геймплей новый

author: {'steamid': '76561198054472989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1388569996}
review:
Wow, where to begin.
There is no base building, there is no tiberium collecting, the unit cap comicly low. 
You can't even build most of the units until you grind for levels for both NOD and GDI. Strategy is not aloud in this game.
To say this is Command and Conquer is a fucking joke, Supreme commander 2 wasn't this dumbed down. Don't even get me started on the ending, if you must watch it look it up on youtube. If you are looking for a mindless unit spamming simulator, this is the game for you.

review:
By far the worst game I have ever played.  I cannot believe this game ever made it past the first idiot who mumbed the words "lets take the C&C name, and then change everything about the story-line, gameplay, visuals, and then make it the most awkward format in existence, and then to top it off, make it look like a shitty pixelated 1998 video game!".

Look up every negative adjective in the dictionary, and then put a citation to "see this game".

author: {'steamid': '76561198041236825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1312268400}
review: I disliked - no, hated this game. As a concept it may have worked, but certainly not as a command and conquer game. They took most of what i loved about the other games and tossed it in a blender. No base building, No creation of giant forces, and no tiberium mining. Plus to worsen the game more they threw the story into the blender as well, the story was short, stupid, and made a terrible ending to the tiberium seires of command and conquer. Spoilers - the tiberium just vanishs along with all of nod. Dont buy this game. Just dont.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984319477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1388447829}
review: I had a lot of fun playing this games with friends. It's not really Command and Conquer as it used to be but it is still a lot of fun , i liked it. Th story and the cutscenes though are a little bit disappointing. Cnc3 was better in that in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061612925', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1388456401}
review:
Das Gameplay hat nicht nur nix mehr mit C&C zu tun.

Es is praktisch schlechtes "DOTA" für das C&C Universum ... viel Geklicke, gar kein Effekt.

Mit dem Genre"Echtzeit-Strategiespiel" hat es sicher nix mehr zu tun. Schon gar nicht mit dem Stil des Genres, den die Reihe ursprünglich geschaffen hat.

Wie es sich anfühlt: Mit Glück grob das produzieren, was man braucht. In der Regel 2 Drittel auf ein Thema, den Rest "Wirr mischen". Mehr als 20 Einheiten wird man nie haben, also von jeder etwas, und a bissi was um die "Base" des Gegners anzughen.

Fakt ist, man kann sein MBF am besten gleich neben dem Gegner MBF parken ... denn wer das Lotto der Units besser mischt, zerstört das MBF ... aber man kann ja ein neues holen.

Unterm Strich heißt das:
- Taktik-Frei
- Resourcen-Frei
- Chaos pur

1% von 100% auf "Tolles Spiel" ... 1% weil, es immerhin nette Videosequenzen hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001586092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1389815909}
review: If you are a C&C fan from the early days, and didn't jump on the band wagon around the release of Red Alert 3, then do not touch this game with a 50ft barge poll. It is the biggest waste of time and the multiplayer is horrifyingly painful to even look at. I love C&C for its base building with very little restriction, the units and the stroyline, this game has none of that. The ending of the story was a disaster as well. If you were like me and were dying to see the end of the Tiberium story line, just watch the GDI and NOD endings on YouTube and you'll save yourself the time and pain of it all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058472997', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1388300569}
review:

How EA can do C&C series game like this shit?
1) Optimisation: on my PC most games play on middle-high graphics with 40-60 FPS. (C&C TW:3 on high). This game ony with LOW can show me ~20 FPS.
2) Inerface sux. Where urs QA?

4) Online game? Pf.
5) RPG system? o_O

Одна из самых убогих игр, которые я видел.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997849773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1692885910}
review:
качал в надежде увидеть "старый добрый" Command & Conquer, а получил очередной клон warhammer 40k и ему подобных с уклоном в online, даже компанию за NOD поленились сделать. в общем любителям стратегий в духе старой школы - не рекомендую, да и приверженцы online замесов вряд ли найдут в ней что-то особенное и новое, все та же беготня с контрольными точками, и убогая "строительная" составляющая, не знаю как вам, а мне эта "примитивизация" уже порядком поднадоела)

в 2023 году еще и перестала ключ принимать, разрабы тупо сперли деньги уплаченные за их кусок кала

author: {'steamid': '76561197984348268', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1387993162}
review: Pretty much as bad as you have heard. The campaign is a very brief set of 17 missions, 3 tutorial and 7 each for GDI/Nod. The story is on par with a cheesy Sci-fi Channel movie and is largely the same for both factions. Gameplay's not terrible once you get used to it, but it's pretty boring.  The main challenge is the incredibly small unit cap which in turn leads to an incredibly small army. This is exacerbated by the bonus units found on most maps which are counted in the cap and can put you over the cap. So if a crucial unit like the repair Engineer is lost you can wind up in a situation where you have to self-destruct 2 or more units to replace 1 that was destroyed. You also have to "level up" in order to access the higher tier units even in the single player, though in practice most of the bonus units are the powerful tier 3 so this is more inconvenient than anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995167532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1332226800}
review: Command & Conquer Tiberian series. Possibly the best RTS games ever made. Deep and compelling story, Unique units and factions, Balanced, easy to learn and loads of fun. Very few people can say anything bad about the Tiberian series. Then there is this ball of rot. Looks bad, terrible story, horrible voice acting. Is this even a Command & Conquer game? People used to say C&C Generals was bad. I doubt anything could be as bad as this game. My advice? Don't buy this game, and if it's free....don't even bother taking it. Just say NO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982568917', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1379299091}
review:
Do not get this game. It's an awful, terrible, extremely sad neuterization of the C&C series.

Given that you still think you may like it, consider this: In order to actually do anything (multiplayer) you must unlock units. You start with a whopping 3 total uinits: light infantry, light vehicle and tank. All of which are completely worthless if you play against someone who has, for some reason, put time into the game. And that is just scratching the surface of the problems!

Even if this product is on sale for 90% off, avoid it at all costs.

I constantly forget I own this game.
That's how shit it is. "ohmyGOSH KANE IS BACK GAISE!"
Yeah... and now that we've all wet our panties and hailed his return I think it's time to put the last nails in the C&C coffin. Thank you, EA Games. Thank you for ruining EVERYTHING you touch. Thank you for killing every game franchise you buy. Thank you for (rather than letting Westwood die with dignity and honour) destroying the name and heritage of C&C.
May all who buy EA Games die of cancer. Myself included.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047494415', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1386446986}
review:
Просто кил ме плиз, графон убогий, тактики боя нету, баланса нету.
Например если ты играешь по инету и у тебя первый лвл то у тебя почти ничего не доступно. И тебя кидает с каким-нибудь 80 лвл который в начале игры строит аватара и тебе gg wp easy.
Юниты сделаны ужасно =_= Можно сказать что эту ахерительную серию запороли. Надеемся что разрабы одумаются и вернут все как было в 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989821458', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
EA screwed up big time on this one. 
They failed the developers who had built an moderately interesting fast-paced RTS game that really had nothing to do with C&C and slapped the brand name on it, hoping it might sell to some hardcore C&C fans. The game itself never got the chance it might have deserved, because it could never be judged on its own merits but always as "The Conclusion to the Tiberium Saga".
They failed the fans of the previous games, because they delivered something that did not understand the value of the gameplay of all the previous titles and threw out time-honored traditions just for the sake of cleaning house.
They even managed to fail the brand itself. If EA has to send out an email that ensures "fans" that they have brought back resource harvesting, removed unit caps and similar basic fundamantals, then it is very clear that the brand itself have lost tremendous value and C&C4 almost solely bears that whole responsibility.
Overall this game fails, not because of what it is, but for what it sets out to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013544509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1338361200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052285921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1532547069}
review:
Took over an hour to get the game started, not counting download time. First attempt resulted in computer rebooting during NET.framework installation. Second time involved a 20min wait while NET.framework installed, then half an hour chasing round for account details, the login screen's link led to an endless loop of entering an email and a code, never once saying 'By the way, you already have an account under that email, you're wasting your time.'

Once all these hoops have been jumped through to the games satisfaction, navigating a somewhat awkward setup menu to start a simple 1v1 skirmish with the ai, to get accustomed to the game. It would seem by default a section of the HUD is missing, map for instance is cut off at about 2/3, only showing the middle and right third. Also lack of a menu button, unless mapped to something suitably awkward, or possibly on the cut off section of the display made exiting to alter settings very awkward.

A ctrl+alt+delete, 5 end task and 1 terminate process later, we come to the third attempt, resulting in entire system locking up and the plug being pulled.

Net result, I want a refund, but terms and conditions state that's not going to happen, so here's to a waste of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008128700', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1318662000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022197242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1387762774}
review:
My overall rating 4 out of 5 stars

Honestly i don't understand why this game got such bad reviews. At no point are you ever forced into multiplayer, like one of the previous reviews said. I've been playing the campaigns and did a few skirmish maps with the AI to level my profile. Which does lead into one partial negative. That being the near necessity of playing one of the campaigns before you start skirmish modes. Apperently the unlocks are tied to yoru profile rank which is persistant in the campaign and skirmish. 

Game play's not really that aweful as some have described. It's more of a elite squad based kind of strategy take on C&C. That may be off putting to some, but you do have a "base building" option with the defense crawler. Just don't expect massive bases like in C&C3. I did find myself useing the offensive crawlers a little bit more than i would have liked.

So the story lines a little anti climactic. Sadly given that it's the end of the series, it would have been near impossible to have actually finished it properly for the majority of the fan base. So i can't fault it for that, though i do find fault in how the cutscenes follow through. It's like there are parts missing. That being said, if you run both campaigns, you'll get alot of the plot holes filled in by the opossite campaign.

I haven't tried multiplayer yet, but when i get a chance, i'll add that review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988414136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
I'd give this game 1/5 stars.

In all fairness, the gameplay is a completely different concept from the previous games. As a concept it's... unique and might have some potential, but they certainly didn't pull it off. If you're looking for a steroidal version of Tiberian Sun and Tiberian Wars, this isn't it. If you're looking for closure to the series, then the end of the storyline is worse than the books following Ender's Game and Ender's Shadow. The story is stupid, the acting is worse, and more immature and childish than Red Alert. Do you really want to know how this series ends? Fine, here it is: Kane makes peace with GDI for free, and in both the GDI and NOD campaigns you are protecting Kane on his quest to cross the portal to join the aliens. The end. Horrible game, total waste of time and money, horrible end to an otherwise great story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069061232', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1377311907}
review:
Как можно мучительно "убить" франшизу? Франшиза необязательно должна умереть с закрытием студии оригинального разработчика. И необязательно умрёт с добавлением резких, кардинально новых деталей в процессе естественной эволюции серии в новой части. Но Франшиза всегда умирает, когда теряет свои корни и основы.
В C&C4 франшиза умерла с лёгкой подачи своего издателя - EA. Потому что в компании кто-то решил, что для бизнеса будет гораздо лучше, если новая часть будет совсем другой. В итоге мы получили следующее. Все базовые и незыблемые основы геймплея C&C спилены накорню, сюжет убог, обрезан и лишён смысловой нагрузки (И харизма Джо "Кейна" Кукана в этот раз не спасает). Вместо классических баз - три вида разбалансированных штаба, выбор между которыми всегда очевиден. Отсутствие классической экономики и ресурсов, скучные и лишённые тактики сражения. Роль Тибериума здесь -  отвечать за прокачку бесполезных и ограниченных в своей механике скиллов. И всё это безусловно печалит...
В игру не хочется играть, игровой мир не хочется изучать.  Приходится заставлять себя проходить сюжетку ради финальных роликов. А если играть приходится через силу - то что же это за игра? Где удовольствие?

author: {'steamid': '76561197969796810', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 0, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 0}
review:
An utter abomination of a game that only earns the right to use the C&C logo because of the live action story involving Joe Kucan as Kane.  Seriously, C&C4 completely abandons every core element of what made the Command and Conquer identity in the first place.  #1) Battles take place more in arena venues than true story dictated maps.  #2) Your unit count is so small that you can forget building an army #3) You cannot build base fortresses and your production capabilities are easily lost and recovered meaning you've got nothing important to defend and no ultimate goal in smashing your opponent's key structure. #4) The ingame economy is so simplified and anemic that it removes any remaining strategic decisions so that it becomes impossible to out-produce your opponent. #5) Progress is slow and boring since you must tediously earn experience points in order to unlock better units. #6) The visual language of the unit designs is no longer clear making it very hard to understand why one unit is superior to another, and not only that but all the units are extremely wimpy with little ability to decisevly break through enemy forces.

C&C4 started out as an experimental idea for a cheaply made free-to-play RTS game and was then forcibly upgraded into a C&C game.  The live action story moments are the only thing worth mentioning about this game to anyone with a passing care about the Command Conquer franchise and for that just go to Youtube where you can see it all for free.  

What a terrible, unforgiveable waste of time and resources this game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966468894', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1373180800}
review:
Fraudulent. A mockery.

This game isn't as bad as they say it is ... it's worse!!! :( Like me, you might think "It's C&C. how bad can it be?" Answer: world-class bad. A complete corruption of the art form by people who don't understand the first thing about what made C&C cool and different from other RTSes, and have ruined the franchise. Highlights: no more concept of "economy" or "base-building"; plodding, ineffectual units; linear "progression" of uninspired unlocks, meanwhile each faction can build fewer units -- not to mention structures -- than ever before; and of course a laughable "story".  C&C has "wives" in it now, did u know?

Overall, it just exudes that particular EA-Games flavor of disgust. $5 I wish I had back, and the bottom line: wherever you may rate this game on the scale from "just plain" bad to "seriously I can't believe how bad it is" bad, your time is most assuredly better spent elsewhere.

Disclaimer: I never met a C&C I didn't like. ( .................... up until RA3 which, questionable as it may be, is still infinitely more playable and "C&C" than /this/ POS.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042820843', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1368774000}
review:
Out of all of the Command & Conquer games I've played, this is the only one I've ever regretted buying. As it's shown through gameplay, it does NOT resemble the traditional build-up-your-base-and-army aspects seen in most of the previous games (Renegades is an FPS game). There's a limit on how much units you can use at one time. It's also not a destroy-the-enemy-base game anymore as it's more like a hold down points of the map type of game.

However, the biggest disappointment I found would be the online portion. First, an internet connection is required at all times even if you're not playing online. Second, because there's a level up system which determines how much you can use (and both factions have separate level progresses), it limits a player's choices within the first hours or days of playing. Lastly, playing online can match people unfairly (players may have considerably large level gaps), leading to games where a new player doesn't have the units a higher level player does, especially powerful ones.

If you're a player who has played CnC games throughout the years, it's likely you'll be disappointed with the change in gameplay mechanics. I really don't think this game is worth playing, but that doesn't exactly mean I'm saying "don't buy it". Buy it if you want, I'm just saying it's not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964153663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 1972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1415558966}
review:
Command and Conquer what happened to you. You used to be the king of RTS. Your cheesy live action cut-scenes were the stuff of legend and we eagerly anticipate your every release.
Now what have you done to yourself? No resources, no armies, no bases? What is this? A shadow of what used to be?
YOU ARE NOT COMPANY OF HEROES!
Why can't you stay the way you used to be? We all loved you and cherished every memory of you? Why do you have to cheapen what we have?
Why? WHY? WHY?!

It is difficult for me to articulate my feelings about Command & Conquer 4 Tiberian Twilight. All I really know is, I don't like it.

In some misguided attempt by what I can only assume is an ill-informed marketing department somewhere deep in the bowels of the EA mega structure this installment of the Command & Conquer franchise changes everything about the previous games. They even went so far as to remove the live action cut-scenes that, despite being where B-movie stars go to die, had become a benchmark in the industry.

You no longer build bases or harvest Tiberium, instead you get allocated a number of points that can be spent on units, when a unit die you get your points back and can try a new combination. It takes what used to be a very balanced RTS experience and turns it into an entirely micromanagement experience, and not a terribly good one at that.

This is not unlike what you might see in the later Dawn of War games but where Dawn of War balanced it with RPG elements making each unit seem important here you are just sending mindless, faceless entities towards a bunch of other mindless, faceless entities in the hope of beating the map objective before you mind rots from the monotone boredom.

Command & Conquer might be viewed by many as the classic simple RTS, but it was the one that monopolized the best on that approach and it was the franchise that more than any other made the real time strategy genre a force to be reckoned with.

Now it is nothing more a boring mediocre clone of a game, trying to do with all the other cool new RTS's are doing but not doing it nearly as well and losing what made the game special in the first place in the attempt.

It is a sad end for what was once such a proud franchise. The older Command & Conquer games will forever hold a special place in my heart but this makes me hope the series will die before another abomination is released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995555267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1492090654}
review:
Build expansive bases and construct your limitless fortress of fantastic in this epic sequel? No? TRUE fans of the series will not be disappointed.

One of the games where every match feels different to the last. Implements a really revolutionary new building mechanic that's truly unparalled in the RTS universe of today . If you thought RTS was good when you COULD build bases...You're wrong...

EA say NO! FUCK OFF! PLEASE! to the mediocre idea of buildings, and turn the genre upside down, inside out, and backwards of square (Barry Ferguson style).

Less RTS Is an improved RTS. Yes, you heard me correctly.

Buy it now otherwise your life will possess a Command and Conquer 4 shaped whole that only drugs and meaningless sex could fill...And we all know which option we would prefer.

review:
If you love the C&C series like I do, dont buy this game. Lately EA games seems to like taking their games in a "new direction" where they remove what the fans really loved about their favourite series (see also: Sims 3). So because of this it feels like your not playing a C&C game anymore. But im not saying that its terrible for being different just that its become something it never should have been. The best way to describe this game is that it would be a great E-sport game.

See also
Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of war II

author: {'steamid': '76561198018979559', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1530271937}
review: Command and Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight (C&C4) is the lackluster follow up and conclusion to the beloved Tiberium storyline of the Command and Conquer series. While crucial for story-enthused players, C&C4 breaks up the traditional base building and attempts to create a rank-based multiplayer game. The constant mobility leaves you feeling that every mission is a commando-based offshoot and fails to satisfy classic real-time strategy fans. The ranked multiplayer makes most matches feel unbalanced, but  there are opportunities for co-op gameplay. All in all, C&C4 leaves much to be desired in every aspect, but the game still holds the conclusion to the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045475420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1466840533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012940957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review: The C&C franchise has always had quality games but they really dropped the ball on this installment. As the last game in the Kane saga, you would expect the story to be the best out of all the previous games. Unfortunately, the story is extremely short, confusing, and just plain boring at times. The game mechanics has also gone through a complete overhaul, but this change is not for the better. The gameplay is just too simple now that they've taken away building structures, resource mining, and the removal of some staple units. The new interface will probably throw off a lot of old C&C players as well. The biggest issue for me was with the balance of the game. You can build any unit extremely fast and since resources are gone, you aren't punished that much for losing all your forces. The only thing that made the game bearable was the co-op. Other than that, this game deviates too far from the series and I'd only recommend getting it for cheap and if you want to see how it all ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004502253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1551977993}

Отвратно даже было сначала, что драгоценный тацид, который я потом и кровью зарабатывал, мы просто так отдали и ещё о нём перестали говорить, опустили!! Да и геймплей соглашусь - дрянь, нужна новая стратегия, отличная от предыдущих частей...
